39069961.review: As an avid fan of turn based RPGs, this is easily one of the best I can find on the market today. The music by Pyhrrna, an indie music developer, is legendary, The game is both very merciful and hardcore at the same time, allowing you to run away from battles at any time, (With some rare exceptions) but requires plenty of planning and of course, heavy strategy to beat most enemies on harder difficulties. The combat is complex and it lets you upgrade the characters how you see fit via equipment and skills, making each leg of your journey easier or harder depending on your decisions. I've never felt frustrated, confused or cheated at any point in the game. It has an easy to understand story line, and the popculture references are a nice touch, especially since this game was originally made from an indie flash game made by Matt Roszak. I can't wait to see what he has in store for EBF5.

When I started this game, I had really low expectations due to the art. I thought I'd just check it out so I could say I'd played it and then delete it.

Well, almost 30 hours later, and here I am... 

This game has a surprisingly great battle system, and the varied skill trees of all the characters give you a ton of options to make characters geared towards your playstyle. I found the combat to be at JUST the right level of challenging, too, where boss fights were tough and frustrating but that much rewarding to beat. 

The huge amount of customizable equipment offers great visual flair to the party, and the ridiculous costumes go perfectly with the joking tone of the game. 

More than anything else, this was just FUN. Once I started this game, I basically put everything else I was playing on pause until I beat this because the gameplay was so addictive.

Just a really solid, fun, light-hearted RPG. Definitely recommend!

TL;DR this game is worth buying if you're into these kinds of things.
I mean, you can get turned into a slime, get eaten by a disgusting worm thing, whoop two feline God asses, destroy entire ecosystems, see cats with no legs and have the girls interact with lewd/hilarous situations. Also, Natz is overall best girl. Prove me wrong ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)


                                                                            [ More under the cut here ]


I'll be honest with you, ever since I found the whole series, I was skeptical at first as to how they would play out. Quite surprisingly, I've fallen in love with it entirely, from the quirky antics that the group always gets themselves in, to the in-depth lore that the creator (Matt Roszak. Bless his soul) has put into. 

Gameplay wise, it would play out as what you would expect from an RPG-esque like game. Statuses, buffs, debuffs, elemental weakness, spell levelling and so forth. And with four different characters to play around with, though you can only have three of them at one go, it can get kind of hectic at times. Not to mention the plethora of equipment that each of them use. Despite the numerous spells/equipment and such, you can go whatever playstyle you like. From a brute dmg build to more of a casual runthrough. Though I recommend building around enemies weaknesses and strength on the higher difficulties cos they would be hitting you really hard. 

Design wise, I enjoy it. It's whacky, colourful and sets the theme of every location just nicely. The design that the creator used for the story is also very cute. The game doesn't take itself too seriously at times, given the numerous times the group would idly talk about. Heck, even the initial casts of some of the spells make it seem like they don't take things too seriously. And despite some small gripes about the group, they're all really well made.

38434368.review: Despite it not having very well developed characters or plot, Epic battle fantasy 4 is one of my favourite games. Why? The amount of strategy needed is amazing, with 10 elements and various buffs and debffs to take into consideration, making the gameplay well-developed rich, and deep. The music is amazing, too. The graphics arent anything special, but are decent. 8/10.

[b]创意：☆☆☆☆☆[/b]

+ 游戏在不同难度下的敌人配置会发生改变，不再是单纯的拉高数据，更具挑战性。

37959880.review:
Ohhhh, EBF. Playing this series is the best kind of nostalgia for middle school me. Flash games may be near-death nowadays, but I remember playing the second and third game in this series on Kongregate back in its heyday. 

The best way to describe EBF4 is that it's a love letter old school RPG's while creating it's own unique identity. While the humor is wildly dated now, and never the drawing point in the first place, what really makes me love this gem is the intricate combat systems and heavy-tactic battles that it's nailed time and time again. There are numerous skills, elements and systems built into this game, and for someone starting out fresh it can be a bit overwhelming. Overlooking a single system, such as changing your equipment for battle or forgetting to cast debuffs at the beginning can make or break later fights. This game has no definition of "cheese;" you earn your victories from beginning to end, because it's the enemies that are overpowered. There are confrontations in this game (specifically in the steam-exclusive challenge areas) that can take upwards of an hour to defeat, with a single misstep spelling defeat. It's thrilling, and a bit draining.

While it is called the fourth one, you do not need to play the first three to enjoy this one. The original games were definitely fun, but they are rough flash games that provided the basis for this one. This is the culmination of those games in it's own charming way, and it's improved in every possible light...except for the writing. Please be aware that the humor is insanely grating, childish and mind-numbingly sexist at certain points, but that is not where the value is. It is not a perfect game, and if you are looking for an RPG with any actual story, I highly doubt this will satisfy you. While the story structure isn't inherintly bad, and the paper cut out cutscenese a treat, the characters and general dialogue are filled with outdated memes and middle school level sex jokes that gave me the worst kind of nostalgia. If this is a dealbreaker, I completely understand.

As far as a game goes, however, there is some serious meat on this beast. I'm a bit irritated that steam does not keep hour logs when playing offline, but my play count for this is easily towards the 40-50 hour range. There are so many secrets and collectibles, with a varied, intricate vania-style unlock system that there is always new equipment and abilities to find and try out. Even after beating the game, I was still finding new secrets things, although my enjoyment had waned at this point. The artstyle is surprisingly cute, and there is an insane variety of enemies and bosses. I cannot emphasize enough how gratifying the challenge areas are, as they actualize everything you have learned to that point, and can be tackled at any time without reprocussion. The concept that the enemies scale to your level means it will always be difficult, but balanced if you go in with some forethought. 

All in all, this game has aged phenomenally well, aside from the elements previously mentioned. It's been almost five years and the new one is on it's way, so it was a treat to revisit. I will most definitely be trying out EBFV, but in the meantime, this game is absolutely worth playing. Keep an eye out for a sale is my best suggestion, or if you want to see if it's your cup of tea, the base version is still available to be played for free online. Hope this helped!

37917013.review: One of the best RPGs available on Steam. There is a wealth of content: a 20+ hour campaign; a huge number of enemy types, weapons, armour, accessories and skills that must be dynamically swapped at all times to stay on top of the enemies' weaknesses and resistances; for the first time in the series, you now control four players, allowing one to remain on the 'back bench' to be tagged in at any time, even replacing a downed ally; the story is light and full of silly references and humor - just the kind of thing we need these days, especially when a lot of other RPGs are going for the gritty, emotional stories (and you don't even need to have played previous games - though they're all free, and EBF3 is also on Steam, so you might as well); plus a save function in the menu and no random battles, so it's extremely easy to pick up and play for short--or long--amounts of time. Highly recommended - don't let the Flash graphics put you off, a LOT of work has gone into this game!

If you like franchises like Pokémon and Final Fantasy, you'll probably like this. The EBF franchise is a surprisingly deep in combat at times, and some battles on "Hard" or "Epic" difficulty can actually be fairly hard. So don't let the cute cartoon graphics fool you.
While the game can be quite hard on "Hard" or "Epic" difficulty, Easy and Normal also exist if you want a more relaxing or casual time. There's something to be had with both casuals and hardcore RPG fans.

Your party in EBF4 consists of 4 party members, and they all have various skills, equipments and weapons. Each focusing on a different stat more than the other. Example:
Matt is the sword user with the highest physical damage and physical defense.
Natalie is the mage of the group and uses a variety of healing spells and magic attack, as she has the highest magic attack out of the group.
Lance is the gun wielder who plays a support role with minor healing and Dark & Bomb skills that the others lack.
Anna is also a support, and like Lance she performs minor healing aswell, difference being she has different type of support skills and she dishes out more Earth, Poison and Wind skills.

These are just minor examples to give you an idea how each character is different.

Each biome you come across are filled with different types of enemies and sometimes mini-bosses and at the end of the biome, a boss. All of these enemies and bosses have their respective elemental weaknesses and strengths, and status infliction weaknesses and resistence too.
Each biome also have hidden secrets like various loot and treasure chests that contain new weapons and such.

Both your party members and the enemies function the same way in terms of strengths and weaknesses. Obviously you have basic stats like Evade, Attack, Accuracy, HP etc. 
But depending what type of equipment you put on, including weapons, hats/helmets and outfits, you'll be giving yourself different sets of resistence or weaknesses.
Example: If you give a party member an electric type weapon, armor, pin and hat that boosts electric armor, then there's a chance your electric resistence is great depending on the percentage.
Here's how elemental resistence percentage works:
0% = Nothing special, normal damage taken.
+100% = No damage taken from said type of damage.
+Above 100% (such as 150%) = Healed from said damage type
Anything in the minus zone (-100% etc) = Weak towards it, avoid it.

Not trying to write a strategy guide here, but it IS quite in depth.

I've played all of the EBF installments, and I'm waiting anxiously for EBF5.

36844998.review:
First off let me say I may be a little more favrable to this game because I played the old ones on newgrounds years and years ago.
Now that that is out there, let's talk about the game.
Epic Battle Fantasy 4 brings you in to a world of slimes, dragons, and all kinds of wacky, fun, and down right challenging fights.
The game play is solid. A point and click where you want to go grid like system, turn base fights, and a pretty decent leveling system.
There are four characters in the game, but you can only have three in a battle at a time. The fourth one sits back as a back up in case one dies.
You can choose who you want as your back up at anytime in the game too.
I mostly found myself using three of the characters only, never switching the fourth one in to level him up.
Which is alright because if you are careful, you will only need the back up in emergencies.
The game has an incredibly silly story, that is over all fun to learn about.
So if you are looking for an alright length game that is pretty challenging at times, this is a game for you.

35216529.review:
EBF4 is a great turn based RPG for people who are into gameplay over graphics.  The game's plot and dialogue are mostly there to be humorous.  Don't expect to see some intricate story or a bunch of character development.  The game's biggest strength lies in its deep combat mechanics.  The music is also pretty good as well.

The game starts with you in the first town and in control of the new main character for this game.  You'll eventually find the 3 other characters.  The map for the game takes place on a 10x10 grid.  The game consists of 3 towns, 5 main environments, a side environment, and a bonus environment that takes place off the grid called battle mountain.  You'll spend most of the game venturing through these areas killing enemies, fighting bosses, opening chests, and getting quests.  Each of the three towns contains a weapon/armor shop, forgeable item shop, and a health/status item shop.  Main environments contain enemies (all viewable) on a main path to that environment's boss that you will have to kill to get to it.  Once killed, these enemies stay dead forever.  Enemies off the main path usually guard chests and are optional to fight and respawn upon going to a new environment.  The side environment contains an optional boss and some items.  The battle mountain is a bonus area which contains all the enemies throughout the game, upgraded versions of each of the game's main bosses, and some unique bosses.  You get no exp/gold going through this area but do get item drops and access to unique equipment/skills.  All environments contain 1 or more quick travel points, so getting around quickly usually isn't an issue.  The game autosaves on every screen transition and can be saved manually any time outside of battle.

Each of the game's 4 characters have access to their own unique set of skills.  You'll be able to upgrade these throughout the game but unlike EBF3, you'll be unable to fully upgrade every skill by the endgame unless you feel like grinding, so you need to choose wisely when upgrading.  New to this game are equipable skills.  You'll find new skills (including limit breaks) throughout the game that 2-4 of the characters will be able to learn.  Once you attach that skill to a character, only that character will be able to use it unless you choose to have that character forget the skill (wasting spent skill points).  This allows you to give characters spell types that they normally don't have access to.  Each character can equip a weapon, armor, a hat, and 3 badges.  All equipment can be leveled up by forging.  Equipment works in a unique way.  Instead of giving simple stat upgrades, such as +30 attack, they instead give bonus multipliers to a character's base stats, such as multiplying health by 1.1, attack by 1.15, etc.  Each equipment gives different multipliers to different stats as well as different elemental/status defenses, and many of them have unique abilities attached to them such as automatically casting revive or dropping mammoths on your enemies.  This means that even your starting equipment can be just as viable to have on as something you find towards the end of the game.  What you want to equip will be based on what elements enemies are weak against, what elements/statuses you want to buff yourself against, what stats you want to buff, and what special abilities you like.  Badges are useful in covering weaknesses that your normal equipment didn't cover.  They do things such as give elemental/status resistances, special abilities, or buff stats.

The game has 4 difficulty settings that you're free to switch between throughout the game without any penalty.  I only played on epic difficulty (the hardest one) and I found the game to be very fair on it.  There was no point throughout the game where I had to grind levels at all to continue on, though I did have to skip 2 of the optional minibosses and come back to fight them later.  Combat with the regular enemies feels just right and the bosses are incredibly satisfying to beat, especially the more difficult upgraded versions on battle mountain and the final boss.  I got my ass handed to me several times, but changing up my equipment/strategy/tactics was enough to overcome any failures.  The only time I might recommend switching difficulties is when fighting the regular enemies on battle mountain.  These fights usually come in waves of 8-10 whereas normal battles are usually 1-3 waves.  I stayed on Epic throughout and some of those regular battles on battle mountain can take anywhere from 20-40 minutes to complete.  If you ever do feel a need to grind, you can always switch the difficulty to easy as enemies give the same XP no matter which difficulty you play on.

As for combat, there are plenty of enemies types and plenty of variations on those types, each feeling pretty different.  There are 10 elemental types and 12 status effects, so you can never cover everything.  Status effects and buffs/debuffs matter alot.  Bosses require both tactical and strategic planning.  You'll often find yourself in situations where you have to make meaningful decisions rather than just spamming the same moves over and over every round.  Combat animations are quick, so outside of limit breaks, you're not sitting around for 10 seconds watching characters cast spells or watching enemies dance around for no reason.  Characters can be swapped in/out during combat.  Only 3 of your 4 characters can fight at once.  I  wasn't sure I was going to like this as I thought it meant someone was going to get left out, but I grew to enjoy it.  All the characters are useful, so you will switch characters in and out based on various things.

I really don't have much of anything to complain about.  My biggest issues were occasional slowdown in some battles and I had the game freeze up twice, once halfway through the final boss which was real lemon timing.  Also, the spacesuit armor is pretty good but its special power can be annoying.  It calls in 'Scanbot' to scan enemies during battle and can activate multiple times over the course of a battle.  Once you've scanned an enemy, you retain its info permanently, so when it does it multiple times it's just wasting your time.

A great RPG, wish more of them were like this.

34749262.review:
Pros:
* Like the previous game, you can create all kinds of equipment setups to strategically defeat enemies. Characters also get three accessory slots this time, some of which have interesting effects like replacing weapon status effects.
* Some of the medals are more lenient this time around, especially the treasure hunting medals.
* Battle Mountain is a good way to test one's skills against equally leveled opponents.
* The skill system allows more element variety for the characters. For example, Matt can now learn thunder skills to take advantage of his Golden Dragon sword.
* The summon system adds more depth to the battle system, since it costs SP that's obtained from killing enemies.

Mixed:
* Like the previous games, the dialogue and story is funny, but not particularly deep. That said, the main antagonist of this game is more interesting than the previous one due to their motives.

Cons:
* There's currently a memory leak due to leftover status icons. The game has to be restarted every now and then to avoid crashes.
* No explanation is given for the party's level reset this time. Though Matt (the character) did mention that he didn't work out enough recently, which implies the old party is rusty.

Some features that would have been nice:
* Level scaled versions of the final boss and glitch boss.
* Resolutions that match Youtube's preferred pixel height.
* A backlog that records recent dialogue.
* A way to disable automatic attacks and counterattacks.

Tips:
* Finish Battle Mountain before fighting the final boss. Without the Battle Mountain equipment, the final boss is about as hard as the fourth boss rush. With that equipment, the final boss will be a lot easier to defend against.
* Take advantage of the tired and weaken statuses against bosses, since most of them have 50% resistance to normal stat lowering effects.
* Don't neglect stat items, since enemies gain more per level than the player otherwise. This is especially important in Battle Mountain, where enemies scale.
* For normal boss rush, beat the boss while they still have weak minions on the field. This will give you an opportunity to reequip and buff.
* Use the developer's kongregate guide to find treasures and secrets easily. http://www.kongregate.com/games/kupo707/epic-battle-fantasy-4-walkthrough
* When fighting the [spoiler]dark players[/spoiler], never take your eyes off the screen while a battle animation occurs. You need to keep an eye out for their limit break indication so you can be ready to defend with Ancient Monolith. On that note, never end your phase with an attack on them, since you could trigger their limit break before you can defend.
* You can't buy chilli sauce like with other rare items.

34225809.review:
Epic Battle Fantasy 4 was a surprsingly and unexpectedly fun game. I went into the game expecting a higher tier RPG maker like game, but it was so much better than those.

Epic Battle Fantasy 4 is basically a grid movement based game with a JRPG combat style that follows from the events of Epic Battle Fantasy 3. That doesn't sound incredibly interesting from the description (which is what I thought as well), but the gameplay, progression, and secrets make it so fun. Oh and don't forget about the witty 4th wall breaking humor. The enemy difficulty scales up perfectly, and often times you will be challenged or have to rethink your fights as you go along (assuming you didn't grind). You can always turn down the difficulty as well if you are feeling too pressured, especially for some of the boss fights.

EBF4 actually has an incredible amount of things to do, stats, and items. There are 8 different elements, and 8 different kind of status effects (if I recall correctly) that you will learn to deal with. Each region has a different main enemy type. Once you scan an enemy, you can attack or use spells according to their weaknesses. Not only that, but there are a bountiful amount spells and abilities to learn amongst your four playable characters (of which only three will ever be fighting at once). Aside from that, debatabely the best part is how the designed the levels and layouts. Certain parts of the grid cannot be accessed until you get a tool, like the hammer to destroy rocks. Even in the very first area you are in, there are things you can do once you progress further into the story. Basically, you can go back and visit your earlier regions and get some good treasures! The game has strategical warp points as well making it not much of a hassle to get from part of the map to another part. As for the visual and audio side, the game has excellent music, good sounds, great fight animations, and nice but childish looking character and landscaping.

The one flaw of this game that I found extremely annoying was that when I ran it in fullscreen mode on my laptop (4k res), it lagged like hell and crashed often. The game has a really weird fullscreen mode (at least it did for me), and I wish they added better support to higher resolutions.

Overall, a really fun game that I would recommend. I might even go through a second playthrough because there is still some stuff that I missed in my first one.

Rating: 8.7/10
Recommend Price: $9.99 or below

34201704.review:
I feel conflicted about this game. One hand its more of the same characters as last time with new abilities and more depths, but on the other hand some of  the changes aren't for the better.

Pros
[list]
[*] Summons that everyone can use, meaning you're not relying on one person for needed help.
[*] A scan summon that scans all foes on the field meaning no more wasting a turn to find out what an enemy resists or is weak to.
[*] A more clearer view of how much damage an element will deal damage or heal an opponent.

Cons
[*] A worse menu that makes it harder to figure out what an ability does, cost, or if what the element is.
[*] A three person battle system that has four people, meaning battles aren't really balanced for the abilities you'll need.
[*] A story that is in the beginning worse than the previous game in motivating you to continue.
[/list]

Now I'm still early in the game, but so far this game doesn't make me want to continue and explore. It just feels like the new character, Anna, is somewhat  like a self-insert character. She comes out of nowhere storywise, and our heroes are just okay with her joining them and tagging along.
Maybe it gets better later on, but the beginning shouldn't feel like a slog to get through because of a new character and horrendous menu design. If it improves as I play, I'll change the review. But as of right now I can only recommended this game to people new to the series, just so you don't come in with expectations.

33624114.review:
En voilà une belle surprise !
Je ne connaissais que de nom les versions mobiles des précédents opus et voici qu'en solde j'achète ce "petit jeu" RPG tour par tour.

Et bien au final je me suis laissé emporté par ses graphismes mignons mais bien trash/violent par moment me remémorant certaines invocations épiques de grands RPG renommés et surtout par l'humour/les références et le nombreuses mimiques des personnages.

L'histoire est classique mais déjantée en restant simple. Oui je sais c'est bizarre dit comme ça.

La bande-son par contre bien que répétitive ne m'a jamais lassé et m'a vraiment mis dans le bain de l'action avec des envolées de guitare bien rock comme il faut.

Le bestiaire et les invocations sont assez impressionnantes et surprenante pour un "petit jeu".

On reste ici sur un fonctionnement classique de RPG mais suffisament efficace pour ne pas décrocher.

L'intérêt vient aussi de la rejouabilité pour ceux qui aiment compléter à 100% les trésors/trésors cachés/invocations/skill/magies/craft d'équipements et armes en nombre conséquent sans être trop pour autant.

A ce sujet le niveau qui nous fait combattre sans gagner d'expérience des monstres redoutables permettant d'obtenir des gains introuvables (invoc/matos/skill/loot/etc...) dans la partie principale mais utilisables cependant dans celle-ci est bien trouvé et bien utile. Un vrai défi !

J'ai pris mon temps, je suis niveau 33, j'ai fini le jeu en 40h et vais y retourner en new game+ pour compléter tout ce que je peux.

Mine de rien, ce jeu hommage au RPG 2D des années 90 mais avec des animations et une qualité graphique de notre époque m'a bien bien BIEN pris au coeur, je n'en ai pas décroché. C'est là le signe des grands.

33612585.review:
[h1][u]Overview[/u][/h1]
Inspired by Final Fantasy, [i]Epic Battle Fantasy 4[/i] is an RPG game with simple battle mechanics, yet complex strategy.  Elemental damage/resistances, status effects, buffs, and equips all play a major part in how your party performs in battle.  Each player gets one action every turn.  An action is using a skill (attack, buff, defend, etc), changing equipment, or using an item.  Enemies follow the same mechanic on their turn, except they don't switch equipment or use items.  In a nutshell, you hit the enemy until it dies.

[h1][u]Map[/u][/h1]
[i]Epic Battle Fantasy 4[/i] has a large map consisting of areas and tiles, which can be traversed using point-and-click pathfinding, or using a keyboard.  Areas are big sections of tiles which make up larger sections of the map.  Areas are inter-connected, and walking off the edge of one brings you to the corresponding area.  There's also map-based puzzles, such as pushing blocks (sounds boring, right?) until they clear a path to a chest, which can then be looted.

[h1][u]Story[/u][/h1]
[i]Epic Battle Fantasy 4[/i] has a storyline.  'nuff said (I'd rather not spoil anything).  There are also side-stories in which characters make jokes, and just talk in general.

[h1][u]Rating[/u][/h1]
I would give [i]Epic Battle Fantasy 4[/i] at least a [b]7/10[/b].  It has more than 60 weapons and 60 armor pieces, not to mention about 60 flairs (a special equipment type that any character can use).  There's four different difficulties and 'Battle Mountain', a place outside of the storyline where you can push the challenges to the limits.  Endless battles, foe rushes, boss rushes, new optional bosses, etc.
Newgame+ is a feature that allows you to continue your profile with all your stuff, but enemies are higher levels to accomodate for you being a higher level.  Sadly, this caps at level 50 (but Battle Mountain scales with your character level, so it doesn't).  My current profile has almost 100 hours.

[b]I would fully recommend this game to anyone who enjoys turn-based rpgs.[/b]

33377716.review:
Epic Battle Fantasy 4


Egal wie man es auch betrachtet, dieses Spiel erscheint auf den ersten Eindruck recht Durchschnittlich oder gar Unterdurchschnittlich. Klar, die Trailer und Cutscenes waren recht lasch. Allerdings bemerkt man die Besonderheit dieses Spiels erst, sobald man sich dazu entschieden hat es zu spielen. Zumindest war es "EINDEUTIG" besser als die Vorgänger. 

Ein recht typischer RPG, aber außerordentlich episch.


Es hat mich 75 Stunden gekostet alle Achievements zu finden und das Spiel auf 100% abzuschließen. Gegen Ende habe ich Werte von bis hin zu 600-800k HP gehabt und einem Offensiven Angriffswert von 26k und bei Nat einen Magischen von 34k. Mit solchen Werten war auch "Epic" kein Hinderniss mehr, wodurch 3x durchspielen + "Battle Mountain" das optimale Ergebnis wäre.


Pro:/ 

- Typisches RPG Action Gameplay.
- Sehr große und übersichtliche Ansammlung an Skills und Ausrüstung.
- Gut ausgebautes Ressistenzen und Schwächen System.
- Unterhaltsamer Humor und Puns.
- Viele Achievements zum sammeln und lieb haben.
- Enthält in dieser Version den "Battle Mountain" welcher nur neue Herausforderungen mitbringt. 
- Einige Nebenquests, welche leicht etwas Abwechslung bringen.
- Epic ist ein ernstzunehmender Schwierigkeitsgrad.
- Wirklich angenehme Musik.

Kontra:/

- Zu viele nacheinander folgende Kämpfe, nur viel zu viele irrelevante Gegner blockieren einem den Weg.
- Viel zu wenig Dialoge, da diese durchaus sympathisch waren.



Für ein Spiel dieses Kalibers war es dennoch unterhaltsam, wer ein Schätzer solcher Spiele ist, wird hier gewiss auf seine Kosten kommen.

32705823.review:
Before I say anything, this is the first Epic Battle Fantasy game I have played, and thus should be taken into consideration about my review.

It might be my fault for misunderstanding the trailers and screenshots of gameplay that I have seen before buying the game, but I had originally believed that the game would use a character creator to build your party and be able to give your characters personalities around it (perhaps I have been playing too much of another RPG which lets you do so).

My disappointment is sadly turning me away from this game. The combat might be solid, but I simply can't see any charm in the lore or the people within it. Dialogue is surprisingly bland, the environments (although diverse) are stagnant and uninteresting. When it comes to RPGs for me, the characters in party and in the world around you need to be interesting in order for me to be immersed in the game I'm playing. Unfortunately, I don't find the protagonist interesting (she might become more interesting as time goes on, but she initially feels like a girl that doesn't care about anything), and the NPCs in the world are even worse.

My problem with the interaction of the world might have been better if I had known that this was a lore that was already set and that the characters are already set-in-stone. I simply didn't see the charm of the game, and it's a shame because the combat is great, and the gameplay is nice, but I simply don't have and excitement for the game when I find the characters and lore this boring. I understand the positive reviews, and more power to them, but I honestly think this franchise might not be my cup of tea.

32511071.review:
If you saw the cutscenes, this game may have seemed like crap. If you saw the trailers or screenshots, this game may have seemed like crap. But if you play the content of the game, then it shines through as what it really is; a gem. In a world of crappy rpgs made by third rate shitty devs, this is a breath of fresh air. It has a level of depth and detail uncommon to most indie titles of the same genre; where other games have stopgaps and filler, this one has quirky mechanics and ingenuity, refining old school rpg elements and adding new ones. The dialogue is surprisingly good, made better by the fact that its not a "click to skip" mess of a thousand meaningless lines endlessly repeated; the messages are short, concise, witty, and worthwhile, a feature so uncommon that it merits praise in this review.

Overall: 8.5/10
Played the series as a kid, and this lived up to the legacy.

30997808.review:
I bought this game from the Overwhelmingly Positive Humble Bundle for 1€.

I can't believe i'm writing a review of this game on Steam after playing EBF2 on Newgrounds in 2009. Time flies.
What is this game about? How the description on the store page says, this is a turn based rpg with cute graphics and stupid humor, how i like it. At first the gameplay seems simple but the game tells you from the first battle to scan every enemies because elemental weakness and resistances are the core of this game.
The game gives you a lot of equipment because to succeed you need to change your gear before starting an encounter or between waves to not be overwhelmed by your opponents. This is a good layer of strategy alongside the usual buff your party and debuff your enemies.

This brings another point i liked of this game, the forging. It's quite simple here, you need to have the materials acquired by slaying enemies or bought by stores to increase the atrritubutes of your gear and some also have passives like random chance to summon a belly flopping mammoth on an enemy each turn, auto cast buffs on your party or a damaging spell after attacking. So try equip and upgrade different piece of gear for some nice combos, don't focus on what looks the best!



The plot is quite simple and funnily enough it serves just as a background for our "heroes" to adventure on the map and acquire gear while doing stupid stuff. That's the charm of this series, the party is a bunch of goofballs with barely working brains. As Anna said: "I have no idea how they survived this long with no survival skills". Quite a different tone from your usual RPG.

Finally, the soundtrack, which is free by the way, is really good. It set up the pace perfectly with happy tunes while exploring the grass areas or fighting the early enemies, to dark tones in the toughest fights. The composer is really good and she made EBF3 music too, check that out!

Now, after praising basically everything, i will nitpick a couple of complains. First of all, some fights will drag a lot, expecially on higher difficulties, where the stats of enemies are increased, and when i saw an encounter was composed of 7 waves i was already rolling my eyes after finishing another long wave or a boss fight. I don't think it's boring, but i tended to overthink my strategy and equip for each wave and probably my brain was melting.
Second problem is that the game offers 4 characters, but unfortunatly it's best to focus on 3 and two slots are occupied by Matt (warrior) and Nat (Mage) for their highly specialized stats so the third slot is contested by Lance (Gunner) and Anna (Archer) that overlap a bit on their utility but many guides and myself went with Anna in the end since she is the newcomer and brings a bit more on the table than Lance (cough, evasion buff).

To conclude my fanboy review, i say this game gave me more than 30 hours of enjoyment for just 1€, and i plan to play   new game+ on Epic difficulty, but i can say that i should have bought this earlier, even at full price (11€.... not a lot) because it's a bargain for someone that enjoyed in his youth Final Fantasy and other turn based rpgs in the PSX era. Just don't let the "anime" graphic, "childish" humor and flash coding influence your opinion on this game.
If you aren't sure, you can play this for free on Kongregate or Newgrounds, the only thing you will miss is Battle Mountain, another end game with extra loot, but unrelated to the main quest, so you aren't missing any plot by not playing it. So you also have a demo, what more do you want?! :D

Now, i'm waiting for EBF5, currently in development, and this time i will get it as soon as possible.

TL. DR. game is good!

30907219.review:
Epic Battle Fantasy 4 (EBF4 for short) is the fourth installment of popular jRPG-esque series
that originated as web browser games. The series is basically a parody of famous Japanese RPG games (mostly Final Fantasy). If you want some more preview on the older games, I suggest you read my review on previous game, EBF3 (which is also on Steam), if you haven't already.

But to keep things short, I'll just give you a small preludium: 
the series started as free browser games that were made for fun and played to kill some free time, and even EBF4 itself can be played via your browser, but there's also an expanded, paid version (AKA the one I'm reviewing now), and it's not exactly cheap, 11,99 USD. Some professional games cost as much, and thus, the game will be judged like one.


So, first, what's the premise?
As a rather typical jRPG like game, you can expect the usual: explore the world, find treasures, both hidden and not, talk to stupid NPCs so they can give you their stupid quests, upgrade your skills and fight the enemies ( and there's lot of those).


[b] The game world	[/b]
The creator approched the matter with a safe and proven method: 
the world itself is open, but it's filled with various obstacles and road blockers (such as rocks or trees, but also more absurd ones, like floating clouds) that make your road linear at first, but with time you acquire means of bypassing them, one by one. This not only allows you to progress, but also lets you find hidden treasures, enemies, and other content, so you will definitely be coming back to old places through your entire playthrough.

As I've said, it's a safe method that was used in countless titles. And it's not a bad thing really. Experimenting is good if you know what you're doing, but if something just works, I see no reason not to use it.

The world itself will charm you with its simple graphics (which are still a major improvement over the previous one) and varied environment, as well as subtle themes to be found, such as various references to other media and clever comments spoken by your team members.  
Overall it may not be masterfully crafted, but it's full of its own unique charm.


[b] Combat[/b]

Combat has always been [u]THE[/u] core element of these games, and as such I'm very happy to say it spectacularly failed to disappoint me. 

Not only it's great on its own, it also improved on everything from the previous games without changing the basis even slightly.
Aside from the usual stuff like attacking, healing and using your Limit Breaks, there's 12 different status effect, 10 elements and over 100 unique skills which can be used BY you, or AGAINST you. Add shiploads of unique pieces of equipment and you've got EBF4.
That means a vast array of different strategies that you can use to defeat your enemies, and believe me, if you play on Epic (the hardest difficulty), you will want to spend some time thinking about them.
Want to debuff your enemies to such point they can barely scratch you? Sure. 
Want to go full offense and counter your lack of defense by making your enemies unable to move? Guess that will work too.
Naturally enemies have their strengths and weaknesses, and there's a whole lot of them (147, to give you the idea), so you will have to use everything at your disposal thorough the game.
Overall it's just what a good turn-based jRPG should look like. Give the players freedom in their playstyle and let them experiment. I have absolutely no reason to complain.

[b] Story and quests [/b]
Each game has its pros and cons, and I've already explored the pros.
Now, the story was never the main focus of these games, but it still deserves some attention. I can't really say much without spoiling it (as the story is partially revealed thorough the game). I'll just say that if you're enjoying the game itself, then the story will keep you interested, but if the game doesn't turn out to be your type, you won't stay just for the story.
The quests are just what they were in the previous game - that is, fetch quests. You are told to get some items, and you either get them from defeating monsters (or buying them from shop), or from some treasure chests, or from other quests. Simple as that. I can't say I expected more, but it certainly would be nice to see a more expanded and developed quest from time to time. Say, a bunch or chain of quests that all give you key items that together allow you to challenge some hidden boss or whatever.


[b] Finale [/b]

The game is moderately long, with plenty of additional content (most notably a fully optional location featuring lots of optional bosses and extremely long and challenging enemy waves, full of unique treasure), and fun gameplay will make sure you will play more than one time.
If you're an old-school fan of the jRPG genre (I'm not, personally), it's a must have.
If you're new to jRPGs or RPGs in general, you should at least give this game a try. If you're not sure about spending money on it, go ahead and try the browser version (or previous games whatsoever). If you happen to enjoy them, then definitely buy it, as it's only better than all that came before.
I give it a solid 9/10

30483819.review:
If you loved the gameplay of old-school JRPGs, then Epic Battle Fantasy 4 is right up your alley. It's one of the few examples of a Flash game that's actually good. The story is silly and almost nonexistant, but the gameplay is satisfying and scratches that JRPG itch. The game is well-balanced almost all the way through, with almost no points that feel badly-designed. If you do pick up EBF4 do yourself a favor and start on the highest difficulty (Epic), as I feel that's the way it's meant to be played. You can always switch to a lower difficulty if it ends up being too much, which is nice.

The biggest flaw I can find with EBF4 is the 3-character party. There are 4 playable characters, but because there are permanent stat-boosting consumable items, the optimal way to play is to choose your party and completely ignore the 4th character for the whole game, because any stat-boosters would be wasted on them.

Other than that, EBF4 is a great game that, while it may not be a masterpiece, is still a lot of fun and an homage to a genre that the game industry has long since forgotten.

30434702.review:
A turn-based RPG with a somewhat unique take on the genre, at least in terms of the usual story vs. gameplay argument. I've never subcscribed to the idea that an RPG needs to have a massive, epic, complex story, and this game seems to agree with me. The story of this game is basically an RPG story template that hasn't really been filled in or built onto, though the details that are there are at least charming and lend a little bit of an identity.

Instead, this game really seems to lean on its gameplay and its combat system. The weapons and armor that you equip can have a huge impact on your stats, and require different tactics to capitilize on their various perks and bonuses. There's a pretty good amount of enemy variety, and encounters are scripted instead of random encounters, leading to some battles that are created specifically to encourage you to take advantage of different armor and weapon sets.

Defeating enemies gives you ability points, which you can spend to learn new skills or upgrade ones you already have. You've got a lot more control over the tools available to you than some other games give you, and I really appreciated that. However, the fact that better versions of skills are added on top of the weaker ones instead of replacing them, and the fact that some skills give you little to no reason to use them mean that the skill pool is smaller than it looks like it is.

Playing on Normal difficulty, I never found myself having to grind for experience or ability points to be able to move forward, but some enemies reappear when you leave and come back, so it's possible to save up some more EXP or AP if you think you need a bit more of an edge. Even when playing on the hardest difficulty, the boss fights never really pushed me too hard, though some of them did take a long time to beat. Worst case scenario: one of tne of the post-game bosses in the Battle Mountain area took me 47 minutes to beat, but I still managed it on my first try.

Beating the game adds a New Game+ mode, scaling up the enemy levels and letting you replay the game starting with all of your endgame equipment. This opens up strategies you may not have had the first time through, and gave me a reason to play the game again. Beating New Game+ gives you New Game++, which just scales up enemies even more. it's basically just New Game+ again, so there's no real reason to play a third time unless you want all the achievments.

The game just endlessly repeats there. You can keep playing New Game++ over and over, and continue getting more stat-boosting items (whose effects carry over as well), leading to some absolutely ridiculous stat levels, and even the highest difficulty fails to provide any meaningful challenge after a while. The game kinda ends on an anti-climax, but the path there is definitely interesting, and given the price tag, it's worth a look, even for people who aren't super into RPGs, since the combat system is so well-refined and easy to get into.

Oh, and the music is just, amazing. Especially that final boss theme.

30279442.review:
Although there will always be some who are resistant to Kupo's monetary direction with the Epic Battle Fantasy franchise, I for one am glad that I can finally support this indie developer who is beloved by his fanbase, not only for the plethra of content he's put out for free online, but for the continued, friendly support he's shown across the board on his games and site.

With that said, EBF4 is a light-hearted take on the RPG genre that takes the best out of its traditional norms and combines them into new, fun, and creative systems. Gone is the abnormally intense grind to level your characters beyond all reason, as enemies and bosses scale to player level, and can be brought down using a variety of strategies based on equips, attacks, and status effects, all of which you continually obtain more of to keep the battle system fresh and flexible to differing playstyles. The story is limited but enjoyable, requiring no previous experience with the series to appreciate fully. And while the map progression is a little linear at first, various secrets and puzzles still make exploration rewarding, not to mention the lack of random battles means you can set your own pace with the game, choosing the order of battles at your leisure.

The addition of Battle Mountain to the Steam version was a welcome change to returning fans, and a great place to accquire game-changing gear to boost your battle tactics throughout the story and beyond. Not to mention, by the endgame, quite a challenge to clear all the boss rushes, making the last dozen or so achievements quite satisfying to get. All-in-all, a must-have for any RPG and/or Flash enthusiasts; the port from Newgrounds/Kongregate was masterfully done, with no noticeable performance issues on my end, as Kupo was thorough in addressing them into and well after release.

If the price tag is a little too steep for you, pin it on your wishlist for a while, Kupo's never modest about putting EBF4 for generous sales throughout seasonal events and not. Or check out his other titles first, here or elsewhere: EBF3 is up on Steam for free, and is a good demo of what you'll be seeing in this one.

30114230.review:
The story is silly and funny. It's full of little intenet speech and memes references.

The big thing that has me recommend this game though is the combat system. It is hands down one of the single best turn based combat systems I have EVER played. I have been playing RPGs for over 20 years, hundreds of them completed. This not small praise. It's an excellent system.

Unlike many RPGs, elemental effects actually matter. Ever single enemy has elemental weaknesses to take advantage of. All your weapons (bar a few non-elemental ones) have elements that deal damage of its type and buff spells of its type.
The game actively encourages you to swap equipment mid-combat to take advantage of the situation. Giving yourself over 100% resistance to an element will allow you to be HEALED by that element! More than once I've had all my team with close to, if not over, 100% resistance and the normally very strong enemy deals pathetic amounts of damage.

I cannot recommend this enough if you love RPGs and especially love good combat systems.

30045091.review:
As a direct sequel to Epic Battle Fantasy 3, this games improves on pretty much every aspect of the previous entry in the series. You liked the previous one and want more ? You'll like this one.

If you haven't, you can start by playing the others but it is by no mean necessary. Epic Battle Fantasy 4 is a basic Rpg made by one man and although it sometimes shows, the game is worth playing if you can get past a few things. Those things will change depending on the player. I, for instance, had to get over the graphics that feel extremely simple, the humor that can be plain or corny sometimes, and maybe the length of the fights toward the end. But once again, those might be assets to some peolpe.

What else is there ? The game is quite long ( about 25-30 hours ), it's got some depth to it that goes beyond enemy weaknesses / resistances, and overall you have fun most of the time you spend in the game if you get hooked. It's honestly still quite impressive for a one-man-game. Plus there's post-game content !

For the price it's at, if you like the rpg genre, and if you have nothing better at the moment, this will definitely be worth your time as a filler while you wait for another release.

29714806.review:
This game is great. I first played this game when it was still in development on Kongregate, having a Kong Plus membership which allowed me to play unreleased, in beta games, one of which was EBF4. I beat it once before it's official release, twice afterwards when the official release was hosted on Kongregate, and now I am part way through my fourth playthrough here on Steam, and one thing I can say is that I still enjoy this game as much now as I did when I first booted up so long ago.

Now, for some actual pros and cons.

Pros:
+Easy to learn battle system, allowing even new players to easily hop in and play.
+Fun, humorous dialogue/situations, one of the best parts of this entire game.
+An awesome soundtrack, with each theme fitting the environment it plays in very well.
+Well designed environments, that do actually feel like they should.

Cons:
-Not really a con, but if you do not properly equip your team, you are going to have a bad time. For example, not using fire-type weapons on Mr. Murderous Plant.
-Some of the puzzles can be confusing, and irritating to solve.
-Monoliths.
-Expanding on the above point, that one battle where you cast Syphon 5 times, and it only works once, and the damn thing keeps healing itself and using charged attacks.
-Expanding even further, RNG.

Maybe not exactly a complete review, but it is 3:15 AM as of the time of me writing this, so excuse me for being half asleep.

全成就了撒花纪念一下----

在此之前我对于flash游戏的评价都觉得是那种短流程小品级的游戏,直到我接触了EBF这个系列才彻底颠覆了我的看法

最早接触EBF系列是在网上玩到了3代,当时就对于这个看似简单但实际各种要素异常丰富的游戏留下了深刻的印象,甚至主动去接触了2代和1代,4代出了很久才玩到也是怪我自己没认真找,不知不觉拖到5都快出了真是(....

作为一个文字量不小的游戏没有中文支持虽然会有点难过,不过实际上并不会要求太高的词汇量,剧情轻松有趣,战斗系统的各种状态和效果也很简洁直白,稍微熟悉一下应该就能灵活掌握

游戏难度上较3代有所提升,系统也丰富了不少,还增加了新角色[spoiler]终于有人和Natalie抢装备了[/spoiler],虽然我因为觉得前代三人组很亲切所以我基本没让Anna上过前排,然后玩下来感觉Lance这作的技能才是最惨的好后悔[spoiler]MD喜新厌旧(X[/spoiler]另外最纠结的莫过于技能的分配,很多前作用的顺手的技能到了这作要其他人才能学真是过了好久才习惯...地图和前作一样特色分明,怪物的资料也清晰详细了不少方便攻略,最高难度下对于装备和技能搭配上要求变的非常高,BOSS的弱点更合理[spoiler]再也没有和3代最终战一样那种无脑沉默的战术了[/spoiler],唯一不太开心的就是虽然有通关三次的成就,但是后两次剧情并没有变化,估计也是制作者认为很多东西要积累到三周目才方便挑战吧...虽然其实不用

我看到评测里有因为难度问题差评的,但事实证明一周目直接全程Epic难度通关完全没问题,而且增加属性的道具以及稀有的恢复道具完全不吃都可以,我自己在一周目就是这样把除了5个rush的成就都做完了,这里不得不再次感叹一下游戏的难度和平衡性设计的如此之好,如果想要享受真正的回合制RPG游戏在此强烈推荐直接一周目走Epic难度,不是靠等级和伤害赶流程,而是充分考虑队伍技能装备的搭配,这样才能真正的感受到这个游戏的魅力

说来这个游戏3代在steam上免费,推荐大家可以先去体验一下3代,喜欢的话再入4代坑,虽然画面还是一成不变的flash,但是内容上绝对对得起这个价钱,5代出的话自己一定立刻去买,虽然预感到到时候自己又要坑进去近百个小时了(ry

29439348.review:
Un bon petit RPG choppé à vil prix sur humble bundle.

Je commence par les moins (-) :
- Le style graphique, faut aimer mais au début je me suis demandé où est ce que je met les pieds.
- La mécanique simple qui est très bonne en soit manque d'un petit truc comme le vol de skill pour être vraiment prenante.
- L'histoire, soit un truc m'échappe encore, soit il n'y en a pas vraiment ... ce qui pour un RPG ... 
...

Les plus (+) :
- Le coté loufoque, l'humour est présent et bien placé.
- Pas mal de references au monde numérique et aux jeux vidéos, Pokemon reviens frequemment, petit clash sur le gamersgate, blagues de geek, bump de boobs...
- La variété d'items disponibles, on retrouve avec un gros shifumi, eau, glace, feu, electricité, terre, poison, sacré, tenebre... A organiser en fonction des combats et de la zone explorée.
- Le système de combat, simple et bien fichu, conforme au mode. Compétences, pouvoirs, invocations... Avec en prime des compétences liées à l'équipement, ainsi on peut voir débarquer pendant le combat un chat d'attaque, un mamouth, des frappes d'artillerie, du soin ...
...

Pour résumer un petit jeu plaisant qui se laisse explorer avec le sourire.

29433997.review:
tl;dr - if you can deal with the performance problems and like JRPGs definitely worth a playthough but expect frequent disruption even on top-end systems.

Pros - Good JRPG style game. Includes all the typical trope along with a unique plot (sort of - team up and save the world, JRPG style) and likeable characters. Very fun and funny game, easy to learn and a ton of stuff to do. Decent but not great controls.

Cons - None with the content or gameplay. Better controls would be helpful but not a big deal. Only real issue was frequent performance problems (the reason I stopped playing). With no resource pressure game frequently lags during combat and screen transitions. Searching the web, this is a common issue. It's apparently a side effect of translating from a Flash game to an exe and the dev can't do anything about it. The issue becomes increasingly more frustrating as you advance - the longer a fight is, the more frequently you'll see framerate drops or even complete freezes that don't correlate to resource contention. Once you get into long fights (post-endgame content) it's not worth the trouble.

29411296.review:
Gra jest brzydko zrobiona, żarty, dialogi i grafika są na poziomie licealistki, która za bardzo kocha anime i też tak chce  rysować (tylko nie umie, więc przerysowuje). Same dialogi są w większości bezcelowe i byłyby miłymi zabawnymi wstawkami, gdyby były zabawne. 
Mamy tutaj cały wachlarz anime trope-ów, stereotypowych postaci i charakterów, nic nowego w temacie, a w dodatku niestety postaci nie mają charyzmy, przeszłości, ani własnego charakteru. 

Trochę poprawia wizerunek gry to, że w wielu miejscach widać nawiązania do innych, kultowych gier (np. bałwan w kształcie creepera z minecrafta), jednak easter-eggi co krok to za mało, żeby grę można było nazwać dobrą.

Gra się w małym okienku, a powiększanie tego skutkuje pikselozą. Gra zacina do tego stopnia, że trzeba zmniejszyć ustawienia na gorsze, a przy tak małej i prostej grze nie powinno być nawet mowy o zmniejszaniu grafiki. Ładniejsze gry chodzą płynniej na dobrych ustawieniach. Ta niestety nie wyrabia.

Fabuła zaczyna się prosto, a im głębiej w grę, tym więcej "niespodziewanych zwrotów akcji", które albo niespodziewane nie są ( i przy okazji zostają okraszone cynicznymi wstawkami postaci), albo są niespodziewane, tyle że głupie. Dużą rolę odgrywają koty obdarzone samoświadomością. Oczywiście, że koty, jakżeby inaczej? Kocie uszka w grze też są. No bo przecież animu.
Wszyscy twórcy gry, zanotujcie sobie: jeśli popełnicie głupotę, błąd albo wrzucicie do gry coś sztampowego i dodacie złośliwy komentarz do jednej z postaci o tym, jaki to pomysł jest zły/sztampowy, to wcale nie poprawiacie sytuacji. Błąd świadomy to wciąż błąd.

Z początku uznałam, że to w sumie uroczy rpg, brzydki i kulawy ale może taki jego urok... ale im dalej w las, tym mniej pozytywów, które trzymają przy grze. Żarty przechodzą od "już to gdzieś słyszałem" do "po co to było", aż do naprawdę wymuszonych. Muzyka z początku wydaje się zbyt "epicka" do prostych walk, potem staje się nawet odpowiednia, tyle że jest już za późno - już się przejadła i irytuje. Fabuła zaczyna się od tajemniczej i skromnej, do przejaskrawionej i durnej.

Nie polecam gry, chyba, że ktoś Wam ją da za darmo. 

p.s. trudno uwierzyć, ale obejrzałam w życiu naprawdę dużo anime. Gatunek ani mnie ziębi, ni grzeje, dobre i nawet średnie anime chętnie obejrzę. Ale to coś, ta... gra... to jedno z gorszych doświadczeń z czymś, co próbuje naśladować ten gatunek. Nie polecam.

29403510.review:
I have played through and enjoyed all three other Epic Battle Fantasy games, and i enjoyed the series. Sure, it's not the best or most complex game, but the skillsets and itemsets and the way the combat work are grippingly fun and highly strategic, and the enemies were interesting the whole way through.

That is, until this one.

The game now no longer lets you win by strategy and you can't use the team you want. Unless you find the secret items or buy the exact ones which you have to use for each specific fight, and then GRIND until max level, you literally cannot win without turning down the difficulty at which point you may as well not play the game, because the story isn't gripping or interesting in the slightest.

If you're thinking of buying this game, play Epic Battle Fantasy 3 for free instead, i wouldn't even pay £5 for this let alone it's actual asking price.

29303973.review:
Epic Battle Fantasy 4 is a good, even great, JRPG that nails the Final fantasy style of game in an indie package pretty damn well. First and foremost it´s extremely flashy and looks great thanks to constant lively animations, vibrant colours and a ton of variety. The combat is engaging enough to keep up the pace and as the game progresses one does need to start paying more and more attention to elemental strengths/weaknesses, though it doesn´t get overly complex at any point(at least on the first playthrough).

The structure of the game carries it and exploring the world opening treasure chests, new story bits, talking to people and beating some mosnters is blast all the way through. The humour works with some stuff landing, some not but the tone is consistent and enjoyable. That said it´s worth keeping in mind that this is very much a full-blown JRPG first and a comedy-game second. Epic Battle Fantasy 4 is both proudly part of the genre and makes fun of the funny parts of it, exaclty as a good comedy-game should be.

All and all I couldn´t really recommend this game more for anyone feeling like playing a solid and pretty as hell JRPG

29113815.review:
J'ai mis la main sur ce jeu pendant les soldes steam, il etait presque donné (c'est la seule raison qui ma fait l'acheter.)

J'adore les RPG, ca a bercé ma jeunesse (les final fantasy, les tales of, les baldur gate etc) Et ce jeu promettait beaucoup de ce coté la ... Eh bien il tient toute ses promesses.

Le jeu est varier:
-Arbre de competence global (vous voulez un guerrier tank/soigneur? c'est possible) 
-Forge. 
-Systeme tres bien ficelé de combat elementaire (mouillé un ennemi avec une attaque eau, suivi d'une attaque electrique multiplie les effets, de la meme maniere, l'electricité + le feu crée du plasma, etc)
-Monde ouvert et pas du tout lineaire
-Des personnages vraiment marrant, qui sortent des blagues tout au long de l'histoire, et qui finissent par devenir attachant (Nathalie je t'aiiiime)

J'oublie enormement de choses forcement, mais je recommande ce jeu fortement.
Si vous etes Fan de RPG en general, que vous avez pratiquer, c'est une avalanche de clin d'oeil (minecraft, pokemon, fallout, FF, mario, Dark Soul, y'en a partout) et vous ne serrez pas perdu dans les mecaniques de jeu, car il reprend tout le meilleur du type.
N'hesitez pas, ce jeu est meilleur que nombre de RPG sortie dernierement !!!

(J'ai voulu le tester hier, ca faisait 5j qu'ils etaient dans ma biblio ... j'ai pas pu le lacher avant d'avoir passé 7h dessus)

28896814.review:
Увидел эту игру в списке рекомендаций, и чем-то она мне приглянулась. Я добавил её в список желаемого, а после, во время зимней распродажи, купил. И о 100 рублях, потраченных на неё, я совершенно не пожалел!

[h1]Сначала о плюсах:[/h1]
+ Геймплей
Двенадцать стихий, двенадцать различных эффектов оружий, сотня заклинаний и ещё сотня предметов экипировки! Для меня это оказалось сюрпризом от небольшой игрушки. По мере прохождения битвы постепенно усложняются, враги становятся разнообразней, а арсенал расширяется! Если вам внезапно попалась СЛОЖНАЯ битва - значит, вы не прокачали оружие/выучили подходящее заклинание/повысили нужную характеристику.
+ Графика и эффекты
Я не скажу, что получил высшее наслаждение, глядя на картинку, но все анимации выполнены на твёрдую пятёрку.
+ Юмор
Вы не найдёте здесь высокоинтелеектуальных шуток, как и не найдётся юмора "ниже пояса". Хорошие, добрые шутки вместе с самоиронией и полным отсутствием четвёртой стены заставили меня не раз похохотать.

[h1]То, что не повлияло на мои впечатления от игры, но нужно учесть:[/h1]
* В игре нет русского языка. Если вы не знаете других языков, разобраться в игре будет достаточно сложно.

[h1]О грустном:[/h1]
- Плохо оптимизированная графика. Серьёзно, играя в половинном разрешении со средним сглаживанием, мне приходилось перезапускать игру примерно раз в два часа, чтобы у меня перестали лагать анимации. Если вам нравится плавная анимация - придётся или выставить низкие настройки графики, или отказаться от покупки игры. (И подождать пятую часть, которую, вроде как, делают на другом движке)

[h1]TL;DR[/h1]
Хорошая игра для убийства времени. Не воспринимайте её серьёзно - и тогда вам понравится.

28757669.review:
[h1]Cosas buenas:[/h1]
[list]
[*]Un nuevo personaje.
[*]Más habilidades, enemigos y equipos.
[*]Arte en flash más pulido.
[*]Invocaciones. Estas no son tan emocionantes como deberían, ya que se trata de las típicas en las que gastas el turno para invocar y realizan un ataque especial para luego irse, lo que se significa que técnicamente son como otra categoría de hechizos. Lo que los sigue haciendo especiales es que los puede realizar cualquier jugador en cualquier momento (porque las animaciónes de la criaturas son muy bonitas y eso, pero en cuanto a mecánica de juego no aportan nada). Otra cosa a favor es que el Contemplador vuelve como compañero para el equipo, lo cual es bueno.
[/list]

La lista de cosas buenas es tan escueta como es, porque este juego es al anterior lo que el segundo fue para el primero: más de lo mismo pero mejor. Así que todo lo que falta por decir está dicho en la entrega anterior y no hace falta repetirlo. Sin embargo encontré varias cosas que no me gustaron y que por alguna razón no me resultaron tan molestas en la anterior entrega.

[h1]Cosas malas:[/h1]
[list]
[*]El sistema de habilidades especiales (las que puedes elegir a qué jugador asignar) no tiene punto medio: o está totalmente claro a cuál de los personajes se la tienes que dar (porque todos los demás tienen ya una que es igual o parecida) o no tienes ni puñetera idea de quién debería tenerla. Sería mucho mejor un sistema con roles más definidos que siga permitiendo repartir algunas habilidades, pero sin dejarte hacer un desmadre. Porque al final acabas buscando consejo en internet de cómo hacer una build que valga la pena en lugar de experimentar y dejarte guíar tal y como deberías hacer.

[*]Hay [b]demasiados[/b] elementos. Esto es más cuestión de gustos, pero en mi opinión con fuego, hielo, electricidad, sagrado y oscuridad basta y sobra. Humedecer a los enemigos para provocarles más daño con rayo o hielo tiene sentido, pero ponerlo como un elemento propio teniendo ya el hielo se me hace redundante. Al veneno tiene sentido que se pueda ser más resistente o más vulnerable, pero no me parece interesante más allá de ser un hechizo que haga daño en cada turno, y en estos juegos los hechizos de tierra y aire siempre me parece que están puestos sólo porque se los considera elementos en otros contextos y parece más completo, pero por lo general no tienen mucho sentido. Y considerar la bomba como un elemento propio (en vez de darle daño de fuego y/o eléctrico), es lo que el agua al hielo. Parece que es ya meter por rellenar.
[/list]

28522427.review:
One of the best RPG games I have played.

I had originally played the online Kongregate version way before the Steam version released. Everything from the characters to the anime references and memes are memorable. Gameplay is fair, it isn't too hard on normal, and although it is challenging to beat on Epic (very hard), it is not relentlessly so. This version also contains features that were not present in the Kongregate version, such as the Battle Mountain, as well as new pieces of equipment. The music is phenomenonal. Fitting for the scenario and masterfully made. Overall a great game.

Pros: Improves upon what made the previous version better and adds more replay value. Good music. Humourous. Great difficulty. Addicting.

Cons: The challenges imposed by Battle Mountain may be too rigourous for some, and that could lead to frustration (also, the final boss, lol). But other than that, I cannot seem to find any other bad things about this game.

28502952.review:
Best RPG combat system I've played in my life (have played about 40 RPGs). This game is not easy and you really have to think and understand it to play on harder difficulties (and you must min-max to win on hardest), but you can enjoy lower difficulty without much thought if you prefer to just have fun. About 50-100 hours of content. Fun and detailed art style, TONS of personality, a lot of scenario variety, and lots of humor.  I haven't had this much fun playing an RPG since I was a kid playing FFX. 


I cannot recommend this game highly enough. I [b]strongly[/b] suggest you stop reading, buy this game (small file-size) and if for some reason you aren't wholly, ridiculously and entirely entertained... well, you can just refund it then (unlikely scenario).

28463790.review:
This is a very fun indie RPG.  It's light hearted, cheeky dialogue and enemies are very memorable and endearing.  I've played it through 4 full times and haven't gotten sick of it yet.

Pros:
- The music is unbelievably good.  Phyrnna (the composer) is up there with the best in the business.  While the game is great, the single most impressive aspect is the music.
- The underlying battle system is very well balanced and expansive.  Tons of skills, summons, items, weapons, variety and it also works well.  You don't find yourself having to rely on the same tactic over and over.  Different enemies require different tactics.
- The dialogue is really enjoyable.  Many, many hilarious lines in this game.
- Nice variety of achievements to add replay value.
- Characters have strong personalities and are very unique.  Quite memorable.
- Puzzles are fun, not too common and well designed.
- The game itself is nicely designed and does a good job of rewarding you for searching for secrets (hidden treasures and stuff, nothing super important)

Cons:
- Can feel a bit grindy at times especially when you get to the battles that have 3 waves.  Fortunately amazing music is there to take the edge off.
- Not enough reason to utilize your 4th character.  It's too easy to just park Lance in the back up slot and never use him.  He's a fun character, but Anna is the better support character since she has access to the party defense up and reflex up buffs.  Lance just can't keep up with her and thus gets overlooked for important battles.


Overall:
This is unquestionably a fun, well made game.  The game knows what it is trying to be and pulls it off extraordinarily well.  Kupo Games is a one man, independent studio who puts out high quality games at good prices.  For the price, this game is a no brainer.  I couldn't recommend it more strongly!

28128881.review:
TL:DR - 8/10 would highly recommend to those who love collecting-achievements and RPGs without taking them seriously

+ 12+ Hours of gameplay
+ New Game+
+ Achievements

- Lag/slow down issues
- Bestiary does not save to other files


Unlike Epic Battle Fantasy 3, I find this version to be harder. The game is longer due to the bigger worlds so EXP and AP leveling is a bit slowed down it seems to make up for the larger worlds and more battles.
Plenty of unlockables and pathways to go, however I find myself rarely using the new girl unless one of the original characters is dead and I am too lazy to revive them.

The puzzles are still a nice challenge, not too hard but not too easy but at the same time some of them are just time consuming and this is due to the slow down.
EBF3 did not have slow-down but even with turning off animations and making the graphics as low as possible my game still slows down and seem to freeze when changing to a new scenary. Heck my game crashed on me after a battle even though I had nothing else running. Now I keep saving more than ever incase it randomly wants to break down on me.

I enjoy the game but the lag/slow down issues need to be fixed, other on forums have reported this. It may be due to the game being larger in size then EBF3 but my game can handle much bigger and better games graphical-wise so the issue is just a massive let-down, specially when re-checking areas for 100% completion.

I would still recommend this game, I have not even completed it once yet and still have 12+ hours clocked in on this and I know generally know what to do and know the enemies already so you do get your money's worth.

Only other bad thing to say is the fact Bestiary does not save over to other save-files unlike in EBF3 where they did and this was helpful because scanning was a pain. The scanning in this one is not so much of a chore but still annoying you need to rescan everything when you start a new game.

28080602.review:
Эту игру я приобрел не раздумывая, будучи под впечатлением от предыдущей игры серии, Epic Battle Fantasy 3, встеченной на одной из крупных платформ флеш-игр. Забавные герои, тактические бои, шутки и отсылки к штампам жанра и массовой культуры - все оказалось как и в предшественнице. Если хочется развлечься пошаговыми тактическими боями, несложными головоломками и спасти мир от могущественных противников, то лучше игры не найти.

Плюсы:
+ пошаговые бои с широким выбором ударов, заклинаний и спец-приемов, различающиеся типами урона и дополнительными особенностями
+ обмундирование не только разбито на тематические наборы и забавно выглядит, но и активно поддерживает попадающие в тему костюма действия. Например, в костюме медсестры героиня будет сильней лечить, а в форме офицера темной армии героя будет поддерживать огнем танк.
+ приятно отрисованные герои и забавные противники
+ герои имеют свою индивидуальность, в сюжетных вставках подшучивают друг над другом и штампами жанра
+ сложность сражений можно настроить - от беззаботной прогулки до серьезного вызова вашим тактическим навыкам

Минусы:
- хоть игра и не отличается сверх-графикой, на слабых планшетах подтормаживает
- чтобы прокачать полюбившийся доспех или оружие, иногда приходится погриндить ингредиенты

Отдельно стоит сказать, что и Epic Battle Fantasy 3 уже доступна в Steam, с ачивками и немного улучшенной графикой, при этом еще и бесплатно. Попробуйте - получите море позитива. И если вам полюбятся ее герои и обаятельный мир - без сомнения покупайте продолжение :)

28001076.review:
I followed this series back in 2009 (starting from EBF 1) and am still following it.

This game was first introduced on a flash game website and to have it ported to my personal PC is the nicest thing to have.

The game is a simple RPG with a linear story line. Tons of unique (even fanmade!) monsters as well as an abundance of costumization for your characters to use. Each enemy has their weakness and each character is good at dealing certain types of damage or being a certain type of "stereotype" role.

Epic Battle Fantasy is a homage to your good ol' JRPG (Japanese Role-Playing Game) and features a keyboard usage as well as mouse usage, depending on what your preference is. The EBF series also has a lot of connections (and easter eggs!)  with Japanese stuff related, especially anime. 

For those who want a simple, yet fun RPG with tons of references to anime, J-games, this game will be fun for you!

The creator is also creating on a sequel of EBF 5 and spin-off bullet hell versions. Also check out EBF III, the prequel of this game! :D

27920702.review:
我是从这个系列的早期作品（EBF1,2,3代）中了解这个作者的，这个系列真的成长了很多，从最早的一个小的flash作品到现在这样一个非常成熟的游戏。而且要感谢phyrnna（HFX）一直以来都极为优秀的音乐。现在，我决定应该为这个系列写一个评论，同时也是我steam上的第一个评论。

[b]优点：[/b]
-复古的回合制战斗系统，适合喜欢早期最终幻想等日式rpg游戏模式的玩家
-各种装备、技能、抗性、buff、debuf和替补f组成了游戏中的战术选择，每一个区域，每一个BOSS和小BOSS都有自己的特色，需要相应做一些准备
-不错的游戏平衡性，如果有一定的经验的话，可以比较轻松的通关，不需要太多的练级
-令人眼前一亮的画风，有非常可爱的猫和史莱姆，也有霸气的执政官机甲和三头龙
-有趣的剧情、对话
-有一些谜题让人时不时的换一换脑子，然而又不至于喧宾夺主
-出彩的音乐，而且音乐dlc完全免费
-游戏内容（绘画、编程）完全由一个人制作，音乐制作则另有其人
-大量的steam成就和卡片供人收集

[b]争议点：[/b]
-战术在高难度（史诗）略微单一，加各种buff是一定要做的，而且由于永久性增强物品的存在，有些人会选择固定增强某几个角色，所以阵容选择也会固定在几个角色上，导致战术核心的替补系统有时候会被无视掉。个人感觉这个更多是每个人的选择，因为我也确实见过、也试过不同的增强选择，多数都是有可行性的（物攻系的Lance,Anna），当然，给Nat加强物攻等除外。（这一点作者在EBF5的更新日志中说到他会根据这些做出一定更改）
-剧情总体有些老套，属于那种坏蛋毁灭世界，好人打败坏人，拯救世界那种，没有太多跌宕起伏的转折。不过各种细节足够风趣。

[b]缺点：[/b]
-没有中文（作者Matt说过，如果他认为这个游戏在中国能获得一定成功的话，会考虑在EBF5添加中文版的）
-Kongregate等小游戏网站上有免费版，缺少一些内容，但大部分主要内容都是能玩到的

嗯，差不多评测就到这里了。游戏时间供大家参考，我现在新档17个小时差不多要打最终BOSS了。不过我在k站上大概还有40小时左右的游戏时间。
假如你不太确定是否愿意买这款游戏的话，可以先试试史诗幻想3（也在steam上，而且免费）和flash版。
另外，做一下广告，作者最近在制作史诗幻想5，进度在他的个人网站([url=www.kupogames.com]kupogame.com[/url]）上可以看，但由于英文有些人看不太懂，我在帮忙管理一个官博（伪），负责将更新翻译成中文，并转载。新浪微博，名字叫EBF_，同时，这个游戏也有贴吧和qq群，欢迎大家关注

27811455.review:
Душевная пошаговая JRPG-шка в духе старых финалок, но менее серьезная. Играется приятно, персонажи запоминающиеся, множество скиллов, саммонов и экипировки позволяют некоторую гибкость в билдах (да, Мэтт прирожденный мечник-танк, но даже ему можно выучить ряд магических атак и дать бустящую их экипировку, сделав его, например, хилером через Power Metal).

Хороший баланс - на нормальной сложности бои приятные и не напрягающие, на эпической - нужно знать слабости и способности противников (не проблема, ведь их можно сканировать, открывая запись в кодексе и всплывающую подсказку на самом враге), подбирать экипировку под них перед каждым боем (или даже во время боя, теряя ход), комбинировать бафающие, дебафающие и дамажные умения, и вообще всячески потеть и стараться, что играется очень интересно.

Мир статичный, но прорисован заботливо, содержит секретные области и предметы, а самое главное - по мере прохождения можно легко вернуться в старые зоны не по длинному извилистому пути, как шли, а срезав кустик или отодвинув камушек, сократить себе дорогу раза в три. Есть некоторое количество головоломок, но более сложные из них не обязательны для прохождения.

Единственный недостаток - Flash движок, из-за которого ограничено максимальное разрешение игры, и поиграть на весь экран в Full HD не выйдет - точнее, можно, но изображение может быть растянуто и некрасиво, как было у меня. Однако, это одна из лучших Flash игр, которые я видел за последние лет 10, а по количеству контента и детальности проработки не уступает многим "взрослым" играм от серьезных студий.

27792234.review:
Je suis fan de la série depuis ses débuts sur kongregate, lorsque j'ai appris que matt a fait une version améliorée de son dernier jeu sur steam, j'ai sauté sur l'occasion.

Mais pourquoi acheter ce jeu si on peut y jouer gratuitement sur flash? diront certains...
Voici les ajouts faits à la version de base:

-Un nouveau monde optionel, peuplé d'ennemis coriaces et de versions améliorées de tous vos boss précédemments vaincus

-4 nouveaux ennemis, qui vous prometteront un combat memorable

-quelques corrections de bugs et glitches dont souffraient la version flash

-De nouveaux achievements

-Nouvelles armures, armes et badges

-La superbe OST de Phyrrna, disponible en DLC gratuit

-2 "fins" supplémentaires (en fait c'est juste un moyen bateau de te faire traverser le jeu 3 fois, une sorte de New Game +)

bref, ce jeu vaut-il son pesant en flouze? ca dépend de votre talent de statège, étant plutot bon dans cette catégorie, il m'aura fallu entre 20 et 30 heures pour tout finir, mais sachez que j'avais déja fini le jeu sur kongregate, un néophyte à la série mettra sans doute plus de temps, ce qui est recommandé pour apprecier ce jeu à sa juste valeur.
Ce jeu mérite ses 10€, mais si vous en etes pas convaincus, vous pouvez tester la version gratuite sur kongregate ou vous prendre la version remasterisée d'EBF 3 disponible gratuitement sur steam.

27575570.review: This game is very much a product of its time. It condenses all that was irreverent, wonderful, and magical about the internet culture of 2010. EBF4 is impressive in its scope. Its art-design remains fresh & unmistakably original. And, its level of challenge is almost without peer. It's also brimming with memes...ancient memes. References that were stale at its launch, and by now practically paleolithic. However, if you experienced the golden age of 4chan first hand, or ever doodled on drawball.com, or spent endless hours playing every free to play game that used to pop up on Newgrounds front page, than Epic Battle Fantasy 4 will be a perfect time capsule for an internet culture long gone, but warmly remembered. Highly, HIGHLY recommended for most every netizen in their mid-late 20s. For others...less so.
