27385935.review:
Considering this is not only a (loving) parody of JRPGs, but was also originally a Flash game, this game is somehow really amazing. 

The turn-based battles are pretty simple, but the summoning system and being able to swap in a backup character - even when the one you're swapping out is dead- is a nice change. And the variety of weapons, armor, and accessories give a ton of options to tackling enemies. Then there's the fact that they can all be upgraded to be even more useful. 

The art style is simple too, but also pretty clean and nice to look at. Basically, it won't turn any heads, but this game is technically several years old from the time of Kongregate. The characters all look really nice and have a lot of charm, especially in their idle animations that love to add in a few fun references. And the characters themselves also have some fun personalities and banter. I really only wish that there was a little more development involved in it.

Next up is the music, which is very fun-sounding and doesn't get tiring to listen to. And considering the soundtrack is free, its definitely worthwhile. The only real complaint I have is that the tracks themselves don't seamlessly loop like you would expect, so it's pretty obvious when they do.

One of the biggest differences from the original browser version is the addition of Battle Mountain, a side world with extra-tough battles. And grinding isn't an option since levels scale (but try to come back later with more skills). It's a nice addition that will keep you coming back for a challenge, in addition to the game's already solid level of content. 

This game is overall a fun experience, that while a bit dated, can still bring some chuckles and enjoyment. So play it if you like simple turn-based RPGs.

27291487.review:
I've been playing this game since it came out on Armor Games and Kongregate. EBF4 is the latest entry in the Epic Battle Fantasy Franchise, an RPG series inspired by franchises like Final Fantasy and Pokémon. 
It has an unique and recognisable artstyle and a quirky sense of humor. There is some story to be enjoyed here, but unlike some other RPGs, you will be playing this for the gameplay. You will be surprised by the lenght and depth of this game. One thing to note though, is that this is in fact a flash game, which means the game does require a mid-grade computer despite the games' simplicity and the steam overlay/keeping multiple tabs open doesn't work as well as usual. 
Even so, grabbing it for either a sale or the full price is a steal in my opinion. 


Pros:
-Quirky cast with the same tone of humor
-Decent Story
-Unique and colorful artstyle
-Good Game Lenght
-No random encounters
-The ability to save anywhere outside of battle
-Surprisingly deep and fun gameplay, while still being very a accessible RPG
-A small party of well balanced characters
-Tons of videogame and other references
-Decent game config options
-A good amount of saves and a autosave feature
-4 difficulties to choose from, providing a good challenge for everyone
-Side quests and Challenging extra content to get even more stuff and replayability
-Good character progression/equipment system (you should find this out for yourself, discovering what I'm talking about    here is part of the fun!)

Cons:
-Only on pc (although there are ways to get around this, including the web version)
-Somewhat low frame cap (although it really doesn't matter for an RPG like this. Trust me, you won't even be bothered by this unless the game lags for you.)
-No Shift + Tab Steam Overlay or F12 Steam Screenshots
-Responds somewhat slowly when switching tabs

Other things to note:
-Good pieces of music, although there isn't that much music in comparison to the size of the game, which means it might get a bit repetitive at times when you've played the game this much.
-There is some puzzle solving involved, although I personally think the puzzles add to the game rather than taking away from it. These won't change according to difficulty, but you don't need to be Einstein for this stuff.
-The humor can get a bit weird sometimes (boobjokes, for example), which you will either love or hate about this game.
-Because of the relatively large game size, you might lose interest before finishing everything. The percentage of people who finished the main story actually isn't that high. Whether this is good or bad depends mostly on the type of gamer you are.
-Completing the game 100% requires a lot of time and mastery of the game. A lot. This might be annoying to some, but does provide a good challenge.


I recommend this game to anyone who is open to games with semi-serious story. You don't need to be a hardcore RPG fan to enjoy this game at all, and you get a lot of bang for your buck. It happens pretty often that the ones playing these games become dedicated fans of the series. 

Epic Battle Fantasy 5 is currently in development and is shaping up to become even better. Epic Battle Fantasy 3 is also available for free on Steam if you want to get a good taste of the series first. Be sure to check those out if you're interested.

I can't praise this game enough for what it is. Just give it a go and see if it floats your boat.

27070278.review: This is a great soild game. I orignally played this game on Newgrounds and was excited that it was getting a steam release. What makes this game work is that at its core gameplay there is a solid foundation of turn based rpg. This game honeslty feels more solid than some AAA rpgs that come out. The mechanics of elemental strengths and resistances works well. You mix up your skills and equipment to have the correct element to hurt them while trying to have defense that is resitant to the element they are attacking with. On top of the solid gameplay there is the cute aesthetic. This game has a cute charm that makes it very likable. 27024758.review: This game is a blast from the past for me, and I'm very happy it's on Steam. It's a fun little Flash RPG, with silly humor and goofy battles, but with incredibly solid mechanics. The battles are fun and satisfying, and can also be pretty challenging on max difficulty. The only issues I feel are worth mentioning are the following two: the character balancing, and the graphics. It's not that the graphics are bad, I rather like the art style. But when you try to play on fullscreen, it lags like crazy, even on higher end PC's. As for character balance, it's hard to ensure all party members remain relevant throughout the game. In my experience, it's typical for people to settle on the three they like most and just roll with them the whole game. While this isn't really a bad thing, I think it would just be more interesting for each character to be built for a certain role, and perhaps to have all 4 fighting at the same time. Regardless, this game is very well made and I loved it long before it ever won any awards (which is hasn't, shamefully!), which is why I nominated it. Great work Matt, Looking forward to EBF 5!

27020264.review:
Best use of farm animals - Steam Awards Nomination 2016

To start, this game is simply amazing.
The characters have their own personality (which is rare for a lot of RPG's), the enemies are stupid in a hilarious way, the bosses are random in a stupid ways.
It's just beautiful.
The story of the game, if what is above isn't enough to convince you of it's amazingness, is the godcat, the creator of the world, is pretty angry at the cats for becoming slaves to the humans, so godcat took away their limbs. Now, an unknown period of time later, godcat has returned and is going to destroy the world unless you stop it.

Other than the game being hilarious, it also has an amazing combat system that's relatively simple and easy to understand if you just try.
Each enemy has it's own weaknesses (or er.. not), and each boss is unique. Each time you replay the game, you find another achievement or easter egg that just makes you fall in love with the game all over again.

If all of this isn't enough, listen to the game's soundtrack. Simply beautiful. The artist, Phyrnna, even has her own fandom (whether she knows it or not).

Matt & Phyrnna, well done.
I truly respect what both of you have done, and am eagerly awaiting EBF5.

26897643.review:
Easily one of the best indie games of recent years. If not one of the best Turn-based RPGs of all time. Speaking as someone who has never played a traditional turn-based RPG prior to finding this game on Kongregate years ago (Unless Mario RPG counts, which i don't think it does.) I can therefore say that this game is a PERFECT gateway RPG. Just enough depth in it's combat system to make vetrans feel welcome, while not alienating newcomers like alot of other RPGS do (Xenoblade and Final Fantasy X come to mind)

The gameplay (once it gets rolling) consists of 3 party members (with 1 in backup).

 Anna is the support class with her basic attacks not doing all to much damage but having alot of skills to debuff enemies or inflict them with bad statuses.

Matt is the physical attacker, with alot of non-elemental high power skills.

Natillie is the Magic user / Healer with most of her power revolving around her ability to deal elemental damage or heal/revive part memebers.

Lance is the glass canon with not much defence or HP, but with a ton of enemy devestating moves.


When you complete battles, you gain EXP and money (In this case, Choclate Coins) like other RPGs. You also gain AP which can be used to level up or learn new Skills or Specials

The difference between Skills and Specials is that Skills are character specific, whereas Specials consist of a pool that multiple characters can learn from. Each special can only be learnt by one party member. This makes for some intresting strategic opertunities as alot of arts are here. 

This game also has Limit Breaks, which to be honest, are not that much different than in Final Fantasy 7. But for those of you unfamilliar, Limit Breaks are powerful attacks that can only be used once a character has taken enough damage. What's different here, however, is that limit breaks can be saved for later use as the attack command is still there, where as to do so in Final Fantasy 7, you would need to keep using Magic instead of attacking.

The equipment system in this game is in my opinion the best type of equipment system in any RPG. No 2 pieces of equipment are exactly the same, nor are there any that are inherently better than other pieces. They all have their own use with their own stats and resistances. I cannot think of any other RPG where i was never like "Oh, this sword does more damage than that sword with no downsides. Better sell my old sword for this upgraded one"

The music is annother shining point of this game. Phyrnna did an amazing job. Explaining it can't do it justice, so i suggest you listen to it for yourself.

Overall, 10/10. If you are looking for annother good RPG that isn't too confusing to get into, look no furher than Epic Battle Fantasy 4.

26860617.review:
TL;DR:
 - game is a bit intensive on low-end computers
 + Lots of content (Summons, equipment, skills, etc.)
 + Tons of achievements (Just click Natalie's boobs and then leave that in your review)
 + 4 different difficulties (Easy, Normal, Hard, Epic)
 + 4 unique characters
 + Free OST with the game
 + So much more

I've been waiting some time time to do a review of this game, considering I still haven't completed it, but I can say I love the thought and content this game provides, as it is far more in-depth than its predecessor, Epic Battle Fantasy 3 (EBF3). This game brings forth so many more mechanics than EBF3, and I just love it to death. Some mechanics were even changed for more balance, which I am happy that ups the challenge, while also making it more fair (no more half health poison damage due to the poison stacking enemies could do).

Only downside is that the game is a bit intensive. Lower end computers might want to at least chanmge the graphics to medium (still might lose some frames).

With about 10 status ailments, a ton of summons and skills, tons of equipment, a vast amont of achievments, silly dialogue, a decent story, with all of this topped off with a fourth party member, I have come to truly love this game in the EBF series. I do highly recommend this if you enjoy a nice challenging RPG (especially in the major bonus area). Not to mention, you get a really good OST for free if you get the game so that's pretty nice. I also highly recommend just keeping an eye on the dev (Yeah. One guy made just about everything aside from the OST) as he is already working on EBF5 if I remember correctly. Check out his website: http://kupogames.com/

If you made it this far, thanks for reading my review. I apologize if this review seemed to just go everywhere, but I really did try to express the joy I got from playing the game. I hope that I was able to express that joy into those reading this. To further express my joy for this game, I will state that I would even do an LP/Walkthrough? Some day when I get my PC back, I plan on LPing the game just because this series has given me comfort and maybe even a reason to live. Rambling aside, I hope you guys enjoy this game.

P.S. This game is getting my "We Didn't Think Of Everything" award! Thanks a bunch Steam Awards! :D

Für Fans des Genre, die Lust auf ein witziges Spiel zwischendurch haben, ist EBF 4 eine absolute Empfehlung.

25867610.review:
比起上一代系统复杂了不少，可玩性也大大提升了。

对的，就是在上一代本来已经很高的可玩性的基础上再次大大提升，如果没有玩过3的，建议先玩过3再来玩4，Steam上3是免费的。

多加了一名队员以后，变成了4选3出战，在战斗中可以随便切换后备队员，进入后备的队员会自动缓慢回血回蓝，在战斗山脉动不动就六到九波的战斗中，你确实需要挑其中一两波来给全队恢复状态。[spoiler] 顺便4代的妹子一直对Natalie的欧派怨念满满………… [/spoiler]

对，我刚刚说过六到九波对吧？3代最多也就4波怪，而这代3~4波怪是常态了，epic难度下每场战斗都跟打了一次boss一样，很考验你的策略和 [spoiler] [strike] 膀胱 [/strike] [/spoiler] 智慧。

怪物比起3代强了许多，3代的沙虫就12W左右血对吧？这里是50来W，而且切了尾巴还会再长，只能把自己队伍防御加满后用毒慢慢毒死。另外4代显示抗性是能精确显示百分比的，比起3代只有一个图标也要先进许多。

人物成长的速度较上一代更快了，25级以后每级都能感到能力显著的提升，但经验也获得的更慢了。

怪物会掉落永久提升能力的道具了[spoiler] 虽然掉率………… [/spoiler]，每种道具统一按每个2%来对基础能力进行加成，这一点比起3代要科学的多。

BGM强烈推荐Van al Tag v2，原声DLC是免费的，这一点再次好评。

总之推荐给所有RPG爱好者，虽然只是个Flash游戏的框架，但是一点不比[spoiler] 某6 [/spoiler]差，回合制自有其魅力，不是么？

***ตัวเกมมี Epic Battle Fantasy 3 ภาคที่แล้ว สำหรับผู่เล่นที่อยากรู้เรื่องภาคก่อนๆ ที่สำคัญฟรีครับทุกท่าน ไปเล่นกันเร้วทุกคน***

สำหรับเกมซีรีส์นี้ มาจากเว็บ Kongregate ที่จริงภาค 4 มันก็ฟรีอยู่แล้วนะ แต่แบบเสียเงินจะได้แผนที่ใหม่ Battle Mountain บวกอาวุธใหม่ บอสใหม่ แต่สุดท้ายก็ลงขายในสตีมจนได้ ซึ่งเป็นตัวเต็ม ซื้อเกมแถมซาวด์แทรกด้วยนะ (มีแบบซีดีขายด้วย ไปสั่งซื้อ Bandcamp โลด)

เนื้อเรื่องไม่พูดถึงดีกว่า พิสูจน์กันเองเลย ตัวเกมสนุกแค่ไหนดูบทวิจารณ์เอา เกมมีจุดเด่นที่ตัวละคร มุขตลก มอนสเตอร์ และแน่นอน ส่วนใหญ่เล่นเพื่อล่าสมบัติครับ บางกล่องมีอาวุธ มีหมวก ชุด เครื่องประดับ รวมไปถึงสกิล อยากเก็บให้ครบต้องซื้อจากร้านควบคู่เอา ของพวกนี้อัพเกรดความสามารถให้สูงขึ้นได้ โดยใช้ไอเทมตีบวกครับ เงินไม่ต้องกลัวว่าจะไม่มี ตีบวกกับซื้ออาวุธยังเหลือบานเบอะเลยครับ

มอนสเตอร์มีสายชนะทางแพ้ทางด้วยนะ ปรับอาวุธให้ดี ไม่งั้นโจมตีไปเพิ่มเลือดให้มันอีก ชิบหายเลยนะ

ส่วนสถานะผิดปกติ ท่าโจมตีพิเศษ ทักษะต่างๆ ควรจะศึกษาเอาตามความถนัดโลด ที่สำคัญ ได้อังกฤษด้วยจะแหล่มมากครับ

ตัวเกมไม่ยากเพราะปรับระดับยากง่ายได้ แต่ถ้าเล่นระดับยากสุดตอนปราบบอสจะได้ Achievements ด้วยนะ แล้วต้องจบเกม 3 ครั้งด้วย บ้าเอ้ย จบรอบนึงไม่ใช่เล่นๆเลยนะ เสียเวลาทำมาหากินหมด

25395319.review:
Купил ее еще в 2014 г.прошел ее 3 раза и забыл. Но спустя 2 года запустил ее снова и опять в нее втянулся. Интересный сюжет. Очень детально прорисованна графика, и уж никак не режет глаза, смотреть приятно. Разнообразная музыка, которая записывается в твою голову и целый день не дает тебе покоя. А геимплей?! Оооо геимплей это чтото. Система схожа с серией FF. Бродим по локациям, собираем, сокровища, ходим по магазинам, покумаем, что надо, идем дальше бомбить мобов. Неплохо поставлена система боя, в которой все сводится не только в бестолковом потыкивании на кнопку атаки, но и в дальнейшем продумывании хода. Например лучше сначало узнать, какая у врага слабость и к чему имунитет, а потом делать вывод, физической атакой бить или магией. Каждый противник по своему уникален и все это сводится к правильному выбору снаряжения, которое можно менять даже во время боя. Система поиска оружия и система улучшения по своему унткальны. Найди 3 пружинки и апни пуху Мэта. Берите эту игру смело! не жалейте каких то 300 руб. По мне игра стоит гораздо больше. Также в стиме появилась 3 часть и к тому же на бесплатной основе. Так же рекомендую. 

10 котиков их 10.

25271337.review:
Epic Battle Fantasy is a RPG that was originally a flash game that you can play for free (but less content). The steam version is an upgraded version with more area, more items and so on.

[b]Gameplay :[/b] This game is a turn based RPG, and not an original one, the gameplay is very classic, yet, it's fun and pretty hard. There is not a lot to say, you can see by yourself by trying the free version, it's worth a shoot, really.

[b]Art :[/b] Well, it's a flash game, don't exepct much about that, yet it's not bad. The chara design are pretty cool and the scenery not bad either.

[b]Musics and sounds :[/b] I really liked the musics in this game, it's catchy and fit the world pretty well. 

[b]Story :[/b] That's the interesting point of the game, not that the story is good but because there is a lot of references in the game. Nothing is serious in this game, you will have fun reading the NPC's dialogues and seeing icons here and there... That being said, It took me around 30 hour to finish the game (with the battle montain, a optional area, finished and all the weapons aquired)

[b]Summary :[/b]

Pros :
- Challenging despite how it looks
- Music
- Funny characters and world

Con :
- Can feel repetitive, also, some battles can be really long without being hard.

80/100 very good game overall, I really recommand buying the steam version of this game.

25153494.review:
I recommend the entire Epic Battle Fantasy series, especially this one and Epic Battle Fantasy 3, almost solely on the wit that Matt Roszak put in these turn-based RPG games.

Epic Battle Fantasy 4 introduces a new character to the party in the previous installment. It also adds even more humorous wit, clever allusions and references, and allegory that sets EBF apart from other RPGs. It plays like an RPG: you have a party; you can select which enemies on the world map to attack; you collect equipment, items (coffee to revive dead players, pizza and other foodstuffs to restore health, etc.), and gold ("chocolate coins"); and you beat bosses. Any more details would be spoilers, so play it for yourself!

Play the previous games first (they're free on various online game portals) to get the story, but don't miss out on EBF4, which is too clever to pass on.

25118638.review: Great game, awesome animation, and mezmerizing music.

25062103.review:
Biased review ahead.

I've been playing Kupo's games for years, since the very first Epic Battle Fantasy game. I've completed every single one - and most, more than once.

With all that said, allow me to attempt to explain why this game is good:
-Elemental attacks\resists system is very intuitive. Very much an old-school JRPG system.
-Multiple difficulty levels, with the easiest one being 50% enemy stats and various attacks weakened to allow the weakest players a chance to progress anyway. Meanwhile, the most difficult setting gives enemies 200% stats and allows them to use their nastiest attacks, making for a real challenge.
-Can be played for free on Kongregate for a try, if you're uncertain. The paid version not only supports the author but also includes a miniboss and boss marathon, as well as some new bosses to challenge players.
-Everything in this game is beautifully drawn and totally adorable in every way; from the legless cats to the slimes to the shrubs and even the characters.
-Jokes are well spaced out, and the game doesn't break the fourth wall too often to devalue it.
-Multiple skills and abilities allow for varied strategies.
-Good clock-time, with new game plus and new game plus plus to extend it even further for those hungry for more.

Now, the cons - for almost every game has some. They are nit-picks, though:
-The game has permanent stat boosting items, and while you have four characters only three are active at a time. This means that the most effective strategy is to dump all the stat boosts on three characters and leave the fourth as backup permanently.
-Eventually your strategy will devolve into buffing your party, debuffing the enemy party and using one big all-target skill or spell for an attempted instant kill. You will be using different skills for different elemental types, though.
-The higher difficulties don't offer increased experience\item\skill point rewards, despite taking at least four times as long (enemies have 200% health on hardest, to the 50% on easiest). This means most players will usually fight trash mobs on easiest and only fight the bosses on the hardest. Even that, only once, for the achievements.
-The game has some of the "but I might need it later" with one of it's consumables (chilli bottle, which refills the limit break bar of a character).
-The huge variety in gear does lend to some very slight inventory management, mostly just before bosses.

I absolutely love this game. 9/10.
-Sleepy

24704729.review:
If you're into RPGs that don't take themselves seriously, or if you're into pastiches of anything and everything, then this game is for you.

It plays really well. Only downside is that, as many people have complained to Matt Roszak before, you spend most of the game with a set of three characters, and leave the reserve one in the dust. Once you have a good enough skillset between three characters, there is no motivation to switching partners unless that partner's ability is ABSOLUTELY NEEDED for a particular battle.

The visuals look cute, I guess. I don't know if the cutesy style goes well with some dark bosses later on, but for the most part, it works. True to Roszak's style, the machines and mechanisms in this game are so well-designed. It's generally pleasing to the eye. The animations are fluid, and the Limits look really awesome. Also, given the certain types of characters that appear in the game, and certain types of armour and equipment you get in the game, I can presume that Roszak has at least done some research into them. So, good on that front.

The writing is class. There is no punny humour, but it still leaves you laughing mad. That's the kind of humour I thoroughly enjoy. I highly recommend players to not skip the dialogues because just reading them shows the amount of thought put into these jokes. Then of course, there are the occasional pop-culture references, so any future reviewer might say that this game is a product of its time, and a sort of mirror to what's going on at the time. There are certain things that aren't recommended for younger audiences, like panty stealing and the Pervert medal, so you'd have to be at a certain age level to be able to understand them -- but when you are, it really comes through brilliantly.

The other language I play this game in (out of curiosity, of course, and because I speak it as my second language) is French -- and the jokes by-and-large translate well, though there are a few lines that sadly, do not get translated well, or even at all. For instance, there's that one laser that's gonna SHOOP DA WHOOP if you're not careful. That line is put in, verbatim, in its English form, in the French translation of the game. And if a French-speaker doesn't understand what 'shoop da whoop' means, it's gonna be lost in translation. There are some parts where punctuation is missing. It's little bits like these that niggle at the player, and make all the difference between a well-translated game and a poorly-translated game. It's not "poor" by any stretch, but could use some work. And in the case where a direct French translation can't be found, a Bowdlerism might come in handy here.

All in all, it's a nice game. For someone who started out indie, this game has done well and managed to relate to any and all corners of society in some way, shape or form, and rightly so. If you're into RPGs, do try this out. If you're into parodies and pastiches, absolutely try this out. And if you're just browsing Steam looking for a game to try out, perhaps give this one a shot.

24510250.review:
So lemme just get some facts and biases straight.

The first game I ever played from Matt was Brawl Royale - a simple flash game that's basically just a reflex game to see how fast you can press a button when prompted. The animation, for me at the time, was pretty dang good and he gained a fan from that moment on. I've played every other game that came out since then, other than the Bullet Heaven ones, and I loved all of them.

If you ever get to read this, Matt, I gotta say thanks for entertaining me for all these years. Hopefully, EBF5 will blow EBF4 right out the water.


Tl;dr - I'm a fanboy and this review may be a little biased. Also, this is my first ever review.

NOW ON TO THE REVIEW!


REVIEW:
This game was originally a flash game that was (and still is) free to play on sites such as Kongregate and Newgrounds. The only real differences between the free version and the Steam one/Kongregate's premium one are the additional weapons, armors, and badges and Battle Mountain. This is a little underwhelming for something worth $12 dollars, I have to admit.

If you've played any traditional JRPG games before, that's pretty much what this game plays like. This may be a turn-off for some, but for fans and newcomers to the genre, I think you'll be in for a treat.

The characters are all unique and interesting in their own way - even the NPCs, while not really memorable, have some choice bits of dialogue. As for the dialogue and text in the game, it's very humorous with loads of little nods and jabs to all things video games.

The plot is pretty linear, so NG+ is really only for maxing out whatever skill you didn't learn and trying out some new tactics.

...That's all I can think of at the moment while typing this up so...

Overall, 8.5/10 - needs more boobs

24277423.review:
之前在flash平台上玩过一小会3，毕竟是比较传统耗时间的JRPG，加之“低龄的画风”没有玩下去。这回也不知道哪根筋搭错吃饱撑的把这个4打通了。不过别小看这个flash游戏，麻雀虽小，五脏俱全。

JRPG该有的它都有。四通八达的地图，丰富的装备收集，优秀的隐藏要素让整个游戏流程都在不断地探索升级中推进。健康的角色培养，合理的属性相克系统让最简单的难度都要合理搭配对应的属性法术来击败对手而仍不失挑战感。整个游戏在系统上的严谨程度和战斗策略的强调甚至超过了不少日厂RPG。

当然，要说游戏最大的特色当然是它的剧情了。嗯，也并不能说是剧情，而是整个游戏流程中几乎不断涌现卖梗卖萌的小细节。主角四人组和NPC们的对话时不时地吐槽开发者，吐槽玩家，吐槽乱入的动漫角色，吐槽自己，加上呆萌的表情，让人大呼可爱。每个道具说明也十分可爱搞笑，经常卖梗。而这些细节也不单单体现在文本上，战斗中的动作也时常能逗乐，lance战斗时打着打着就突然开起了坦克，natalie和matt也是一对活宝，前者经常在战斗时掏出ipod听音乐，后一位则直接倚着剑睡大觉（还梦到暗恋中的natalie）。即使是只出现一次的怪物，也经常使出莫名其妙的招数来活跃气氛（哇触手怪你在对我的anna做什么！

别看steam平台上玩这个游戏的似乎没多少国人（st版本没汉化应该是主要原因），但史诗幻想这个系列在国内还是挺火的，可以在贴吧看到好多同人文233。

4位少男少女展开征程，在旅途中插科打诨，抖机灵卖卖萌，顺手碾压挡路的怪物，最后击败邪恶的创世猫神(?)来拯救世界，我想这可能就是完美的JRPG剧情吧。不需要苦大仇深的虐恋情节，也不需要铺得大却不合理的世界观，作者通过自己的爱与热情打造出了史诗幻想这一可爱的系列，虽然画风简陋，又何尝不是让人玩着能感到由衷开心的游戏呢？

24245585.review: Epic battle fantasy 4 is a slightly challenging rpg. It is a remake of a flash game that was later greenlit. This game makes you think more than most current and past gen rpgs. 24222401.review:
To think, this game started life as a flash game on Kongergate:

I'm not kidding about that statement, it baffles me to think that this game is flash. I've been playing this game with very little previous knowledge of the series and I've been loving it to pieces. EBF4 is a lovechild/parody of games like FInal Fantasy and other turn-based RPG's. So right off the bat, if you like those games then you will most likely love EBF4. Not a fan of JRPG's like I am? Then continue reading as this review will be based on that mentality.

So first thing you may ask is "What if I'm not great at RPG's?" No worries, EBF4 has multiple difficulty settings so you can either worry about resistances and stats or just use the flashiest move you have. So what is so different about this game that I shoud considering it worth my money? Well the game is not serious, like at all. The game is part parody after all so the game is very funny and makes a ton of jokes at RPG's and gaming overall. The 4 charecter's are all really interesting and have a ton of good lines. Other than that, there is the previously mentioned simple but intuitive RPG combat mechanics. Most of your attacks are in the form of spells and trust me when I say there are plenty of spells to customize your movesets out. The game is very straight foward too, NPC quests is are short and sweet and there are only two optional areas to visit. Yet despite the linar design, there is a ton of replay value. The main story is about 8-12 hours but you can play through the game multiple times with harder foes and do other stuff like collect all of the medals and weapons. To tie all of the game together there is simplistic but charming art style and one of the best soundtracks to a game ever, I'm not even kidding when I say that last part.

So overall, would I recommend this game to newbies of the RPG category, maybe. Would I recommend this to long-term RPG fans, definetely. Would I recommend this to those who just want to play a silly and fun idie RPG to enjoy,  yes. The game is cheap and I guarentee you'll like it.

24185715.review:
The Epic Battle Fantasy series started out as just a bunch of flash game you could play on Newgrounds and Kongregate back in the day (and you still can). For the longest time, they had stayed in the top rated flash games for both of those sites, and for good reason. This series is pretty obviously inspired by them, and if you're a fan of turn based strategic combat in RPGs similar to old school Final Fantasy, you'll love this game.
If you're on the fence on whether or not you want to buy this, you can simply go on Kongregate or Newgrounds right now and play the free version. Now you may be wondering, "If I can play this game for free, why should I buy the Steam version?" Well other than supporting a series made by a developer who does [i]both[/i] the coding and the artwork, with a quality soundtrack by Phyrrna (aka HalcyonicFalconX) that comes for free upon purchasing it, the Steam version comes with additional content, including a new area with tougher challenges that yields extra equipment to help you out on your main journey, not to mention being able to keep your save files on the Steam cloud. I also recommend Epic Battle Fantasy 3, which is now on Steam, and is completely free.
Now this game does have some intermittent performance issues when it comes to frame rate, but you can toggle the quality to deal with it, and other than that, I believe this is well worth the money. I usually wait for games to be on sale, but I bought this game as soon as it was available on Steam, and I don't regret it one bit. 
The dev is currently working on EBF5, and I eagerly wait the next game.

Honestly this game is really good and was worth the ten bucks. I'm 17 hours in and still haven't beat it so there's definetely quite a bit of content here. The enemies all look different, yet are distinct to their element. The art all and all is very good, with limit breaks giving you these fun crazy destructive attacks. There is a bit of grinding and the combat is turn based, so if you don't like turn based combat this game isn't for you. The grind is pretty minimal and throughout the story are the fairly generic characters making funny remarks and conversation to keep you interested, but there isn't any award winning plot here, as the game doesn't take itself seriuosly, but that gives it creative freedom for some funny moments to keep it more fun than serious. 
               So overall this game is 8/10 which for 10 bucks is pretty good. 24047182.review:
Wieder mal ein sehr schönes Spiel dieser Reihe!

Genau wie im Vorgänger eine sehr schöne Grafik (zu beachten: es ist Ursprünglich ein Flash-Game!), wunderbare Musik und immernoch ein Rundenbasierte Kampfsystem, das mir sehr gefällt.
Durch den neuen Charakter wird wieder ein neuer Wind in die Gruppe gebracht, die noch immer mit vielen Sprüchen,Anspielungen und Witz durch die Welt ziehen.
Die vielen verschiedenen Gegenstände rufen wieder nach wackeren Entdeckern, die sie alle haben wollen und schreien im Anschluss nach den geduldigen Item-Farmern, um neue Waffen auch schnell auf die maximale Stufe zu rüsten.

Was mich überrascht hat ist die neue Unterteilung der Zauber zu Fähigkeiten und Specials, wobei die Fähigkeiten immernoch Charakterbeschränkt sind und die Specials können von mehreren erlernt werden, aber nur einer kann dieses Special besitzen.
Durch die VM-Items (?), wurde eine neue Art der Abgrenzung eingeführt, wodurch bereits durchspielte Gebiete noch einmal interessant weren. Den neu hinzugefügten Schlachtenberg habe ich bisher noch nicht getestet, bin aber gespannt.
Von der Spielzeit will ich mich noch überraschen lassen, denke aber dass ich erneut viele Stunden an diesem Spiel verbringen werde.

Kurzum: Ein würdiger Nachfolger der Epic Battle Fantasy-Reihe, der mich nach kurzem Anspielen sofort wieder in seinen Bann gezogen hat. Jedem der ein paar kleine Rätsel nicht scheut und ein Rundenbasiertes Kampfsystem mag kann ich nur diese Reihe ans Herz legen.

23777501.review:
I bought this game due to the large number of positive reviews, but frankly, I'm not impressed. The combat mechanics are competent, but there's nothing that distinguishes it from any other turn based RPG. Furthermore, the game isn't particularly difficult, so it never feels like your choice of skills or equipment really matters, since you'll be able to beat any enemy without much hassle anyway.

The puzzles are pretty standard "find key/item to unlock area," or "flip X switches," or "push this boulder out of the way" affairs that are quite easy to solve.

The humor and plot are comically childish and shallow, to the point where I was questioning if the story was written to be intentionally terrible. But perhaps I'm not part of the intended audience; I just can't imagine anyone over the age of 12 finding the humor or story compelling.

23775825.review:
EBF4 is a wonderful little game available for free on browser.  While there is extra content, it's probably not worth the price of EBF4 on steam by itself.  I'd recommend trying out the game for free on Kongregate first.  Personally, I purchased the game on steam more to support the developer than for the extra content and have not regretted my decision.  The purchase convinced me to go through another playthrough which was very enjoyable and took a good 10 hours to run through.

That being said, the game has little immediate replayability after completing the campaign the first time around.  It's very possible to get through all of the content in one playthrough, and the story is very linear.  The mechanics and general gameplay are very fun for sure, but there is little to no incentive to come back and play again.

Overall, 8/10.  Fun gameplay, great graphics, but little replayability.

Looking forward to EBF5

23005217.review:
In today's era of multi-tasking, it's not enough to perform just one job at a time, or even engage in a single recreational activity. Take right now for example, you're probably not just reading this review. If I had to guess, you're also eating lunch, catching up on your netflix backlog, listening to music, and browsing your favorite p... nevermind. Some jokes are just too easy to make, and that's no fun. 

The point is, we're living in a time where all of our eyes, ears, and limbs have to be used at their maximum efficiency. On its own, Epic Battle Fantasy 4 is a solid little RPG. While its threadbare plot and meme-filled writing won't win any awards; there is a certain [i]je ne sais quoi[/i] about the adventure. This might be attributed to the fact that boss-monsters tend to guard items that assist in exploration. The first boss guards an axe, which can be used to cut down all of the trees you might have passed by earlier. This is a linear game, but there's always an incentive to go back and collect treasure you couldn't reach before.

EBF4 employs a lot of ideas specifically designed to keep gamers playing as long as possible. Alongside traditional avenues such as gaining experience, you also strengthen party-members by collecting materials and upgrading their equipment. Practically every weapon and armor has an element tied to it, and if you're playing on the hardest difficulty, you'll want to take full advantage of elemental strengths and weaknesses. To really get the advantage, you'll want to explore and obtain all of the rare stat-boosting foods as well. Since this RPG offers New Game+, which begins directly after the defeat of the final boss, you may find yourself caught in the cycle. This all-too familiar hamster wheel promises opportunities to make your party-members even stronger, and see those lovely stats & numbers get really, really high.

Unless you're playing on the harder difficulties, EBF4 works quite well as a "second-window" game. While you're playing this decent little RPG, you can watch some videos, read a book, or do whatever else. There are a few charming cut-scenes over the course of this game that will draw your attention and remind you of what's currently going on. Otherwise your mind is free to wander onto other topics as you lead the heroes through the motions: Kill monsters, collect treasure, upgrade loot, etc. 

One thing I have to nitpick about is how enemy waves are handled. Most battles tend to involve multiple parties of monsters. When you destroy the first set, another set will take its place. This is all well and good, but I have a complaint. If the last enemy in one wave is killed with a counter-attack, the next wave that appears will get a free turn. I figure that this is because it's still considered the "enemy's turn", but it's pretty annoying when it happens. Some of the references and dialogue are also dated and uber-cringe, but it's not that big of a deal. I mean, some of the lines are just plain dumb, but I've already forgotten most of them. Of course it helps that while I played this game I was reading [i]Three Kingdoms[/i].

With a game like Epic Battle Fantasy 4, there's only so much to talk about. Either you're 100% behind the idea of leading a plucky group of adventurers in the pursuit of higher numbers, or you just want something to busy yourself while watching four twitch.tv streams at once. For what it is, this is a fine RPG, just don't set your expectations too high.

22864689.review:
[b]Although I don't quite understand the [i]huge[/i] amount of love and praise for [i]Epic Battle Fantasy 4[/i], I did enjoy my time enough to give it a thumb's up.[/b] Is it worth twelve bucks? I really don't think so, but its frequently on sale - and it is worth something. It is quite fun and addicting, if not a bit repetitive. I feel it suffers from a quantity-over-quality aspect where there are metric tons of items and crafting recipes, but its all just 'stuff'. Like, I don't care about the loot items, only when I can upgrade my sword. That kind of thing.

[i]Essentially, you grind through enemies over and over.[/i] You get loot, you upgrade, you grind more. It is addicting, and the animations and music are all great. While the humor really shines, the story is quite forgettable IMO.

[b]Pros:[/b]
+Fun classic RPG that gets a lot right
+Great animations and music
+Great humor (wayyyy better than [i]UnderTale[/i] IMO)
+User interface is pretty well done

[b]Cons:[/b]
-Storyline is meh
-Tons of items, but who cares what they are - only if they can be a 'part' to craft that new sword (this is hard to explain)
-Very grindy; you just grind enemies the whole time
-Probably not worth full price IMO

[b]I've enjoyed my time in it so far, and will likely finish it.[/b] I'd totally pick this up on a sale.

22830873.review:
So, you're wondering if this game is worth your time? YES.
Worth your money? Yes. definately!

In this game, you control Anna, a ranger whom ends up tracking down the team of Epic Battle fantasy 3 on the accusation of them having stolen the gem of her village. You end up going on an epic adventure with them, going through adorable settings all over. The game is beautful with hand drawn settings that have tons of love in them, making every single area feel likable, even if it's not your favorite!

You'll be playing with a total of 4 characters, having 1 of them on backup in case your main team falls, and for me that meant that the person on back-up often ended up being forgotten in regards to stat boosting items and equipment upgrades, but that's how i like to play the game. The person in back-up gets XP just like everyone else in battle, as long as they are alive at the end of the battle. Switching someone out with the back-up is smooth and seamless at the single press of the button, and if you regret it you can always switch right back. The battles move at your own pace, as the enemies cannot take their turn until you are done with yours, making the game move however you want it, wether you wanna go fast and spam your strongest move or if you carefully want to plan out the next upcoming turns.

The game thrives on it's exploration, the humor and hidden references (which unfortunately had to be partially censored at least by name in order to avoid legal issues as far as i'm aware), but most importantly the music. Oh man, the music is great! It's often high tempo, but it calms down when it needs to, and it does a fantastic job att setting the mood for the current situation, which is really the only thing you'd truly want out of music for an RPG game.
The game also features a bit of puzzle solving and NPC quests (most of which are fetching quests where you give them crafting items of different kinds) but if that's not your slice of cake, it's not a problem because the quests are entirely optional as far as i know, and the puzzle solving, while mandatory in some parts, is never so difficult that you feel like you want to take a break because the puzzle is just difficult.

Now, there is a free to play version available on the web, both on Matt's own website aswell as several different gaming websites, but there are a couple of differences. Mainly, on the premium versions on the gaming websites as well as the steam edition, you can access an area called Battle mountain, which features tons of bonus equipment, items, skills, summons and more. But most importantly, it features some very heavy challenges, ones that will have even the best of players on the edge of their seats as they lose over and over, slowly making progress towards that sweet goal, giving you a dark souls feeling of success when you finally complete the ordeal! That takes me to the difficulty of this game!

Overall, this game isn't particularily hard in many ways. The puzzles aren't extremely complex for the most part, the battles shouldn't give you that much trouble, and there's plenty of oppurtunity to heal yourself in between battles (one of which is just to stand around, as you do have natural regeneration on both MP and HP), but here's the fun part.
On the options menu, you can instantly switch between the 4 different difficulties at any point on the world map, and since the battles are all actively triggered along with fleeing being 100% reliable, you can customize the experience according to how you like to play your games!
If you want to play through the game having a chill time, you could just cruise through on easy.
If you want to play through the game having a TOUGH time, you should play on Epic, which is when the game itself becomes so incredibly difficult at some parts that you might have to end up fleeing a battle, changing your entire equipment loadout and then trying again. However, if you feel that a battle is at any point TOO difficult for you, it's always possible to simply flee and turn the difficulty down.

As for equipment, there is a ton of variation in everything from weapons to armor and accessories.
Every character has their own type of weapons, and every type of weapon comes in a varied and unique form, ranging from a gun made of marble in the shape of a fist that will smite undead foes and steal health based on how much damage you do to a bow that will inflict random status ailments on each hit to a staff that is a literal incarnation of deaths' scythe, you'll find your favorite to use pretty quickly. However, even if you find the number one weapon you prefer, almost never will weapons feel obselete as enemies come in a ton of different elements and forms, and weapons almost always carry with them a special element, so ultimately, it comes down to deciding wether you want a weapon for its stats or if you want it because of the special effects it triggers. A lot of different equipment trigger special events before your turn starts, such as a random attack triggering before you get to act, or maybe a random positive buff on your character.
The armor is divided into two groups, one with male armor and one with female armor, since there's 2 of each in the game. This is nice as upgrading one set of armor could potentially benefit both of the specified users, however i feel this is also a slight drawback as if one armor set is used by one character, the other one has to use a different once, which can lead to trouble sometimes if you are for example looking for specific elemental resistances and you only own 1 armor piece which protects against it, as you'd then have to choose which one would be allowed to equip it.

Furthermore, accessories are shared across all your characters, and they come in the form of small badges, and while the effect more often than not isn't extremely impactful, it's nice to get small additional bonuses from time to time.

Overall, this game is alot of fun, any fans of RPG games or JRPGs will most likely instantly love this game, and for people that aren't into RPG's yet but are looking for somewhere to start, this would make a great candidate!

Rating for this game:
Visuals: 9/10
Audio: 10/10
Gameplay: 8/10 (my only problem is that i wish there was some other way to control the battle menu besides the mouse :C)

Final grade: 9/10

If this game is on sale, do consider buying it, as it will 100% garanteed (by me) be worth it.
Also, you gotta give him some credit, it's a single (not relationship wise) guy doing so much work, by both drawing everything, programming everything and man, you KNOW there's been put some blood, sweat and tears into this game! 
I love it!

22768759.review:
Epic Battle Fantasy 4 despite its quirks is a reasonably well made JRPG with a solid combat system that comes with interesting itemization(optimization for fights ahoy!). Sadly I found the story rather lacking. Obviously it makes fun of many stereotypes in the genre and overal tries to make jabs at how easy our heroes mow through zones while npc's pretend like it's all ever so hard...

In the end I cannot help but feel that the lack of any kind of story to get invested into really hurts the game since it really only has the gameplay going for it. When a serious game makes a joke or two you can really appreciate them since they contrast with the serious nature of the game. Epic Battle Fantasy 4 sadly makes a joke out of everything which ends up making everything unfunny. 

So is the game worth playing? I bought it for about €3,00 or so and I'd say the 25 hours I got out of it were easily worth it. Get it at a discount and you'll have fun without trying to justify the price. I enjoyed the game since it has solid combat and itemization but it's not going to be something people will talk about much since storytelling is often such a strong part of JRPG's and it simply hurts the game not having much of any.

21890064.review:
A very cute and quirky turn-based JRPG. If you only have a laptop that's a few years old (like I do) you may need to turn down the settings a bit as there's a bit of lag. If you have a good computer, though, max it up. So, here's what you need to know about the game before you buy:

1. It's a turn-based JRPG. Think Final Fantasy up to FFX and you'll get a good idea about what you're getting into.
2. There is a story, though it's usually behind a lot of humor, including a bit of meta humor. If you want a game where there is a story, but with a lighthearted tone (for the most part), this should be good.
3. Depending on how you play the game can be preeetty lengthy. It depends on whether you want to grind just enough to beat the bosses or grind A LOT and look around for any treasure.
4. Lots of skills to learn and equipment to find, and all of them can change your appearance. It's a good way to mix and match the characters you get in terms of the roles you want them to have in combat.

12 dollars is an alright price for what you get here (though it'd probably be smart to wait for a sale). If you're really stringy about if you want this game, though, you can play the first three EBF games (as well as a slightly stripped version of this one) for free on most flash game websites.

21883201.review:
The Steam trailer is kind of awful. Anyway…

Epic Battle Fantasy 4 is a turn-based RPG. This was not my entry into the series, I played this and its three predecessors over at Kongregate. Yes, that’s right, I played this Flash game for free on Kongregate. And beat it. Several separate times. And when it came out on Steam, I bought it, and beat again. Yeah, you can play a slightly less content version of this game for free if you want. But stay with me for a little longer as we get into this recommendation.

I’m not going to deny the game is a little immature. I mean, “anime boobs” is right there on the Steam page. But I will say it’s not that horrible. The fan service isn’t really overbearing, nor is it even all that present. A comparison would be, if you watch anime that includes fan service, then this game has less. If you think most/all anime is horrible and incredibly juvenile, then you should probably pass on this game. Just putting that out there.

The game is lighthearted and doesn’t take itself seriously. NoLegs the cat has no legs (all the cats have no legs, actually), Matt is a big sword fan (in both meanings), etc.  Character dialogue (no voice acting) is humorous in a cheesy, silly way.

Look, I bought this because I enjoyed the series, and wanted to support the developer. I do recommend getting this game on a sale. You want a demo? You don't want to buy it? Look it up online. Play it. You’ll miss out on a little bit of extra stuff. Whatever, I can’t stop you. Steam version does come with free soundtrack download though, and the soundtrack is pretty nice.

21695439.review:
Epic Battle Fantasy 4 is an adventure RPG game, developed by Matt Roszak, releasing on Steam is February 2014. This is my first foray into the Epic Battle Fantasy series and have no other previous experience with other games in the franchise. 

Gameplay is a simplistic RPG style view, with turn based combat for the fights. Controls are so simple; you literally can play the whole game with just your mouse. The game has a real “Pokémon” feel to it, as you explore you will find parts of the map you can’t explore yet because you don’t have the required skill, for instance, to cut a tree down or to smash a rock. Once you learn said skills, you can backtrack quite easily to explore and find treasure hidden in the previously locked area.   The game has well over a hundred different enemies to kill, and learn their strengths and weaknesses of.  My favourite part of the game play is easily the loot and item system.  The game boasts over 170 different items for your characters to use; you can upgrade these items through using the Forging mechanic which require you to use craft-able items to make the upgrade.   

The combat system is really well designed too; you have a party of four characters eventually, but you can only use three in a battle, the fourth acts as a backup in case one of your others dies. The Pokémon element theme is a key mechanic too; making sure you use the correct weapon with the right effect on the enemy is an almost absolute must most of the time.  Characters can also learn “companions” which acts as like “ultimate” attacks, and any of your characters can use them rather than having them bound to one of your party – the best and most fun by a country mile has to be the Super Nova, which just obliterates the entire screen. 

Visually, EBF4 is again, simple, but that comes across very pleasantly. The in game art style looks colourful and vibrant, and has a very 3DS look to it. The narration parts of the game are done in a beautifully, almost hand drawn style of art, as if they have just been pulled out of a children’s book. I was enchanted by the visuals straight away as soon as I saw this. There is little animation in the game, given the 2D aspect, but the small amount of animation in the game is done really well, no odd movement cycles or strange looking attacks. There isn’t any voice acting; however there aren’t walls and walls of text to read through, so that can be forgiven. 

EBF4’s difficulty levels can be changed on the fly, and you are almost encouraged to play on the highest difficulty until you start hitting a brick wall. I played the game on a normal difficulty and still felt sufficiently challenged by the fights. You can ramp up the difficulty to epic mode for those wanting to get extra achievements though. Once you complete the game you have the option for New Game+. Not to mention the Fire Mountain area of the game. This area scales with your characters level, allowing you to take on unique beasty bosses for extra special loot. This for me again, reminded me of the Pokémon games and the Elite Four trainers. 

The world, in which you play in, is full of extra little bits to do, with roughly 20 side quests to complete, which offer no real variety but still add a bit more game play. The quests are only collection quests, so don’t expect to be getting really in depth quest lines like other RPGs. The quests will reward you with stat increasing items, or more equipment to make use of. There are also a number of NPCs scattered around the world that whilst they offer no game play advantage, they do have a bit of lore behind them though. 

EBF4 took me just under 20 hours to complete. I went into this game expecting it to be over in five hours. I am absolutely amazed at how much content and how long this game actually is. What really does this game the most credit is, I wasn’t bored once whilst playing, and I wasn’t waiting for the end of the game to roll around as I was having that much fun playing. There may not be a massive amount of replay ability given the linearity of the storyline, but the New Game+ mode will definitely cater for any people that are fans of the game play.  

Technically, the game runs in a much smaller resolution, whilst you can play full screen, it is a scaled up version. For some reason, I almost had a lot of stuttering during some moments in the game. This was fixed by reloading the game, but I couldn’t quite work out what was causing it. Obviously the game isn’t very taxing to run, given the 2D graphics, but still, I was dropping frames every now and again.  The game cannot be played using a controller without the use of third party software, but I would recommend people play this game with their mouse. 

To sum up, I am absolutely amazed at the quality of this game. It is easily one of my favourite RPG experiences I have ever had. I remarked quite a bit in this review about the resemblances between EBF4 and Pokémon, and that comparison really does this game justice. It is an absolute masterpiece of a game that looks so simple on the outside, but is beautifully and carefully developed on the inside. The game is so perfectly priced at £8, 99 too, with hours of content and high quality content at that! 

[b][u] Tom's Score Card[/u][/b]
1) Stay away
2) Not Recommended
3) Only recommended when on sale
4) Recommended
5) Highly recommended
[b][u]6) This is a must play[/u][/b]

21262523.review:
Epic Battle Fantasy 4 ist ein rundenbasiertes Rollenspiel mit viertköpfiger Party. Es gibt zahlreiche Möglichkeiten, seine Charaktere zu entwickeln. Beispielsweise gibt es neben charakterspezifischen Fähigkeiten auch einen Pool an Fähigkeiten, die jeder in der Party erlernen kann.
Verschiedene Ausrüstung und Waffen bringen diverse unterschiedliche Boni, wie z.B. eine automatische Konterattacke, alle paar Runden fällt ein Mammut vom Himmel und macht Schaden oder Resistenz gegen Feuer. 

Im Kampf kann man "Limit Breaks" starten, wenn ein Charakter genug Schaden kassiert hat. Der führt dann eine besonders mächtige Fähigkeit aus, wie über 6 Runden einen Haufen Giftschaden, alle Gegner einfrieren oder alle Verbündeten wiederbeleben bzw. die Lebenden mit einem "Schutzengel" beim Tod automatisch wiederzubeleben.

Man kann im Laufe des Spiels auch insgesamt 24 Kreaturen sammeln, die man dann im Kampf beschwören kann. Die Aktivierung im Kampf kostet SP. Diese bekommt man durch das Töten von Gegnern. Die Kreaturen führen dann eine Attacke aus, die besonders mächtig ist oder anderweitig positive Effekte bringt.

Das Spiel selbst hat ein Animesetting und nimmt sich selbst nicht sehr ernst. Die Entwickler haben auch viele Anspielungen auf die Popkultur eingebaut. Ganz offensichtlich lieben sie Nintendo und insbesondere Pokemon sehr. 

Für den ersten Durchlauf braucht man je nach dem, wie sehr man die Welt abgrast ca. 20-30 Stunden.
Will man alle Achievements machen, sollte man das Spiel drei Mal durchspielen. Man startet hierbei nicht immer von Null, sondern kann die Charaktere am Ende des Spiel in ein "New Game+" bzw. "New Game++ usw. mitnehmen".

Epic Battle Fantasy 4 war für mich insgesamt sehr spaßig. Es bietet eine günstige Alternative zu den Vollpreistiteln und steht diesen in Sachen Spielerfahrung in nichts nach.

21194831.review:
A game that doesn't look great but is rated 98% on Steam, uh..? Okay, let's try the Flash version... Ah, the agony, you have to point and click to move the character around, they're moving on a grid and you get ugly icons everywhere you point at... My, my. The character designs aren't exactly good... Okay, since these are both one-man projects, I'll at least say that it looks much better than Undertale. It also beats it in terms of laughs and overall complexity.
Really. It's absolutely hilarious, and also excrutiatingly overwhelming at the beginning of the game. Ah, those crafting materials...!

After an hour I decided to buy the Steam version, and couldn't stop playing it ever since. This is nothing like a RPG Maker game, it seems to use its very own engine (which, amusingly, is quite slow even on a high-end PC... Thankfully it's still playable). This has a lot of advantages.
It pays respects to its elders but never tries to be lazy about anything. My main complaint? It's a very difficult game... If you want to 100% it, you'll suffer. A lot. Be prepared to spend tens of hours on it. I'll just be happy with at least two thirds of the achievements. If you don't mind not getting everything, then... I get it's doable. But you'll still need to grind a lot, or use a money cheat to buy all of the items you need.

And this was my 42nd Steam review, a milestone for any self-respecting geek. Not my finest hour, though!

EBF 4 is a game about 3 kleptomanic heroes who accidentally endanger the entire world. Again.

This game features a very good artstyle, music and an excellent gameplay. 

The combat in this game is made in a early RPG fashion - 3 heroes out of the 4 available are in active combat and it's turnbased.

It also does feature a high degree of customization as you can select the combination of your party and some of their respective skills yourself.

So, for anyone out there who is a fan of good old RPG-fun ... I do recommend this game for you.

20971438.review:
I was looking for a game to stray away from my action RPG binge in the last few weeks. I wanted something easy to play and comedic. Epic Battle Fantasy 4 was my pick.

This game concept is very interesting. It borrows a lot from the classical JRPGs of the old days, but it also adds its own flavor to the mix. The graphics are unique and are based on Flash animations, similar to lots of web games, which I loved.
The dialogue, and the battle system, is filled with humor, dark humor, internet humor, memes, references to classical JRPGs, etc.
This game was designed for internet-savvy audience to enjoy it. There is a lot to love about this game.

I never played the previous games in this series, however, I can not wait to see what is next. I am striving to have a 100% achievement score on this one. This feeling is similar to when I used to play Pokemon, and gotta catch'em all vibe, it was tedious to do yet fun and we wanted to do it. EBF4 is definitely in that category of games. Players will not only enjoy its humor and battle system, but also will enjoy being completionists.

I recommend this game to any RPG, JRPG, humor, internet, and anime fans. All of you will enjoy it.

P.S.
The "Pervert" achievement was the best!

20706547.review:
Você se lembra nos primórdios da era do CD-ROM quando comprávamos nas bancas de jornal por uma pechincha e com a promessa de uma biblioteca gigantesca de jogos onde na verdade poucos games interessavam de verdade, Epic Battle Fantasy surgiu nessa época como um RPG de flash, possuía mecânicas interessantes e divertia por certo tempo. Após tanto tempo a sua quarta versão foi lançada no Steam mantendo o mesmo aspecto, porém enquadrando a linhagem dos games casuais.

Desenvolvido por Matt Roszak o game possui o mesmo estilo de seus antecessores, porém bem mais completo. No jogo você irá trabalhar com quatro personagens cada um com habilidades e golpes diferentes no qual devem lutar e viajar pelo mundo para recuperar um artefato perdido que é responsável pela vida de uma floresta.

A exploração do game acontece em meio a cliques no mapa que é todo em 2D, porém ambientado em diversos locais distintos, além da variação do ambiente os inimigos também mudam conforme o local criando assim uma fauna específica do game. O jogo faz a todo o momento referências a diversos outros jogos principalmente satirizando o estilo RPG. As mecânicas de RPG incrementadas ao jogo são bem simples e consiste apenas em equipar o melhor item e saber qual a melhor habilidade usar em um combate.

O combate do game acontece em turnos e durante essa luta existe ataque simples e sistema de vantagem sobre elementos, esse sistema é muito presente nos RPG’s, principalmente na série Pokémon onde água ganha de fogo, fogo de gelo e assim por diante. Isso também está presente no game, porém o próprio jogo te dá isso de forma simples e fácil, tornando o game muito simples mais uma boa iniciativa para crianças que querem começar a jogar um RPG.

O bom game cai para os jogadores mais acostumados justamente por ser muito simples e fácil. Como é um game casual não possui erros graves em sua programação, porém algumas coisas podem ser levadas em conta como o fato do jogador não poder jogar ele em tela inteira e poder apenas batalhar com três personagens por vez sendo que um sempre fica de reserva. Essa limitação não faz sentido já que o game é bem fácil você sempre se esquece de trocar o personagem para fazê-lo subir level também. Tirando esses detalhes o game é bem legal pra jogar no tempo livre e bem divertido para aqueles que querem começar a se introduzir no mundo dos RPG’s.

20303589.review:
一般我是通关之后才会写评测，但是EBF4值得打破常规。
首先说一下为什么EBF一出来就是4。
这是一个个人作品，系列作有10多年的历史，除1代是个半实验作品，2/3/4都是一个完整的RPG。所有这些，最初都是基于Flash开发，本作是首次移植到Steam上。因此性能低下等Flash的通病也带了下来。
画风从初代到现在没大变化。以现在的视角来看，画面也属独树一帜，可以想象此系列的画面在刚推出时超前于时代。
作为一个单机RPG，它拥有所有要素。
其中最值得称赞也是不能错过的是剧情。从2到4，不断丰富的世界观，主角们的爱[strike]恨情仇[/strike]。西式RPG的特点体现在永远充满幽默的对话上。
本作另一特点是[spoiler]敌我双方角色互换[/spoiler]。比如，[i]我们有noleg，敌方也有猫(不是史莱姆猫)。灌木是最开始的敌人，后来变成了Anna的宠物。[/i]
其他优点: 音乐/收集系统/属性系统/装备系统
不足: 地图系统 (不利于检索)
值得高兴的是EBF5也在制作中，虽然由于个人开发的原因，进度缓慢，但是一定会出。最新的EBF5开发进度在这里: [url=http://kupogames.com/category/epic-battle-fantasy-5/]Category Archives: Epic Battle Fantasy 5[/url]
对于系列作品感兴趣的话可以复习之前的作品，官方都有免费版。[spoiler]另外2/3/4均有非官方中文版[/spoiler]

20281498.review:
这款RPG游戏整体感觉很不错，
画风虽然非主流但是蛮精致的，或者说别有一番风味，回合制的战斗场景也蛮[strike]酷炫的[/strike]不错的；
音乐也挺棒的，每换一个特殊场景都会变成贴合当前场景的背景音乐，不会让人厌烦；
剧情的话因为是全英文，所以只是大概的了解了一点[spoiler]求汉化！求汉化！求幻化！我想看剧情！听说挺有意思的啊！[/spoiler]；
游戏性就我看来也是蛮不错的，有一定的解谜因素，虽然很简单就是了，而在战斗的时候你可以针对不同类型属性的怪物使用不同的武器装备[spoiler]其实就是换装啦！换装啦！换装啦！[/spoiler]，也能使用各种种类繁多的法术支援战斗；
整个游戏进行下来，其实蛮休闲的，难度不调高的话，基本一个鼠标左键点点点就行了。 so easy！！
而如果难度调高的话，你就要好好考虑装备的升级，以及每个人的技能加点了，需要注意的是特殊技能会相互冲突，一个人学了，其他人就学不了了，还有那些提高属性加成的物品也要好好斟酌给哪个角色使用才能发挥好的效果；
恩，总的来说，这款游戏还是很值得入手的，很适合我这种休闲中带着点小思考，愉快的进行游戏的小伙伴！

20048243.review:
A really fun, and funny game. I'm surprised by just how much I enjoyed this.
The skills are cool, and some are amusing (Like dropping a tank on top of your enemies), and I was playing simply to unlock more skills to see what they were like.

There isn't a lot of dialogue, and most of it's just random comments from the characters when you use new attacks are find something new, etc. Although not really bad in a game like this, it'd be better if there was more story to it, no matter how much seriousness said story lacks.

It's not all that difficult if you play on normal, most enemies are some kind of creature crossed with an element, and so have weaknesses, you get a scan bot that lets you see said weaknesses so honestly as long as you don't forget to keep your weapons and skills diverse you're going to be fine. Each area generally has a focus on one or two elements, so you can focus on those with your weapons as well.

The shop so far has been pretty pointless. I've not completed it yet, but I've literally only bought a few coffees from it before a boss, you don't really use items enough to use up the ones you find, and the weapons you find are generally good as well. Getting materials for crafting is simply a case of grinding as well.

Been playing the since the first Epic Battle Fantasy on Kongregate.com. Was not disappointed by this.

You will play as 4 characters each with their own themes and skills that match. You start with 1 and quickly collect the rest of your party.

Minor spoiler for party formation if you play previous games: [spoiler] You start as the new game character instead of any of the original characters. [/spoiler]

Combat is really simple yet can be indept. There are attacks and spells, buffs and debuffs, resistances and weaknesses. Enemies have attack patterns which can be predictable at times.

There are numerous pots. Equipment wise, you can equip a weapon, a headgear (hat), an armor, and 3 flairs (badges for small bonuses). While you can not craft any items, you can upgrade them to improve their existing stats and sometimes add new ones.

Story is cheeky and predictable. Humor is the same as previous games.

Overall buy it if you like a decent rpg.

19778256.review:
打开商店页面发现这个游戏已经有了999篇评测（97%好评），其中没有一篇中文的，那就来让我当第一千篇吧！

非常精致的小游戏，有良心和幽默感的独立制作。我这样的划水玩家用了接近20小时还没有通关，而且据目前观察即使通关后也还有更多的游戏内容。总体来说这是一个经典类型的，以战斗为核心的日式RPG——可是慢着，为什么我的敌人都是些没有腿坐在灌木丛上的猫咪？为什么我的人物会一边探索一边毒舌吐槽他们的制作者？为什么明明是奇幻世界观，我的角色身后却忽然冒出来了轰鸣开火的四号坦克？！——整个游戏内遍布着小小的惊喜和冷幽默，战斗系统非常紧张合理，可爱的卡通和四处冒出来的梗使得惯常的刷刷刷在这里也不会显得无聊。随难度而定，战斗本身既可以很轻松又可以很有挑战性，让你不得不花费时间研究所有技能的加点（非常自由）和装备属性与强化（描述很搞笑）。

总体而言，这是一款内容丰富节奏紧凑的可爱游戏，对于40人民币的价格而言是完全合适的（更何况肯定还会有很大折扣）。最近发现这个有爱的厂商又出了另一款游戏——弹幕天堂（Bullet Heaven）——顾名思义是一个弹幕游戏，似乎完全继承了价格（40元）、笑点、高游戏性和好评率（目前100%好评率）等打折不妨也考虑考虑吧！

19749214.review:
This game I bought because the different art styles were all cute and interesting. What followed was a shockingly good experience that I really didn't see coming.

This game is based on RPGs like Final Fantasy and Golden Sun, but where they can be very slow (the former, particularly), this one is incredibly fast paced. I've played a fair amount of FFxiii, but I managed to catch up to my playtime for that game in a much shorter span due to how enveloping this game can be; I've wiled away more than one night by just playing the story of this.

Grinding is possible, but wholly unneeded. It seems most of the enemies have some kind of scaling, but maybe I was just at the perfect level for everything... Not being able to tell which it is is a very positive thing.
It also has a Game+ mode where you just restart the story with all your levels, skills and equipment. This is a nice feature, but I wish it had asked first as I was close to a few end game achieves that reset with the story.

The actual gameplay is, as I said, fast and flowing. A little less dependence on the mouse would have been nice (you need to click to exit combat, for example), but I still love the way this game controls. Although the interface is mind-bogglingly complicated when you first see it, everything has its place and all fits together surprisingly well for a system as detailed as this. There're skill trees, equipment collecting, weapon and armour modifications, 'flair' trinkets, stat boosters, element resistance, buffs/debuffs... You get the point. But by a few hours into the game, I understood the majority of it.

Character balancing was a bit off for me... I dunno if it was bad use of stat items and skills, but my best fighter was also my best healer and had half the max health of my others. Due to the sheer number of options, I found it hard to keep it straight in my head which character should have which (I did consider making some kind of spreadsheet, but decided against it), but I managed to complete the game on normal difficulty without too much hassle. Don't think I ever lost a fight.

Enough about gameplay, what about the story and tone? The tone is brilliant. Spot on. Phenomenal. It'd be worth playing this for the characters' interactions alone. It plays beautifully with RPG and gaming tropes, references are everywhere and as I said at the beginning, the art style is amazing. Cutscenes are done in a felt-style looping animation, battles are anime and overworld travel are chibi things. They all work surprisingly well together and give the game a very lighthearted feel that becomes all the better when the team encounter horrific atrocities.

Also there's a little easter egg that I stumbled upon entirely by accident, but could NOT stop laughing at. I won't spoil it. But damn. It just epitomises the game.

Overall, this is a fantastic light RPG that is deep enough in gameplay to be elevated beyond the flash game it is and become one of my favourites. Resolution options are terrible, mind, and it isn't integrated with steam very well. Still. Amazing game.

19544582.review:
This game is a joke, being a parody of Final Fantasy,
BUT
It's not a joke.

Not only does this include a difficulty system that actually tells you everything major that changes (Besides things like the Bomb Slimes and Purple Squids entering battle with nine poison stacks on Epic) but the game is still reasonably difficult without putting it on Epic, unless you're so used to Epic that in your second playthrough on on a sequential save half of the enemies one-shotting you in the power plant due to you being two levels underleveled feels normal. My first experience with Epic was nearly getting killed on the first battle in the game, gg. What truly makes this game difficult is Epic is insanely hard, but you can adapt to it. You can get hit by the enemies and survive, and most things that the enemies can do aren't out of your power, unlike a lot of games you see today. It puts the player and the enemies on nearly equal ground, but manages to still keep the game reasonably difficult. That is a sign that the game's difficulty is well designed.

This game contains parodic references to almost every game in the book that your childhood was composed of. My favorite cluster of references is the graveyard in Graybone Cemetery, there are many tombstones on one screen, a few of them are damaged, but the ones that aren't contain jokes that are mostly references of some sort. This is only a pinch of what is included in the actual game, though. 

The dialogue in this game somehow keeps a decent balance between "Absolutely hilarious and cannot be taken seriously" and "Deep storyline" despite the final boss being *SPOILER* a cat god.
I think my favorite thing about the dialogue in this game is either the fact that there is a one-liner for nearly every skill in the game, or the fact that dialogue can randomly trigger when walking around the map, and these times it's at it's funniest. There is one cluster of dialogue where Lance is staring at highschoolers and Natalie calls him a pedophile. Another is a conversation between Matt and Lance where Matt seems to be trying to explain to Lance that despite all the cameras he apparently has in his posession that he uses to stalk Natalie, it's still stalking and over the top stalking at that. The items even get some of this amazing humor, every one having a one-liner for a description. Achievements even get thrown into this bucket, there is one that nearly everyone knows about for clicking Natalie's boobs.

The only negative that comes to mind is the lack of an optimized full screen resolution and no access to STEAM features ingame, besides syncing, achievements, and cards. However this is understandable for a game ported from flash.

There isn't much to say about art style, it's not super duper flashy, and it definitely doesn't try to be edgy. It just tries to be cartoonish, cute, and funny, as it should. 

I can't say much about the music, purely because music is almost never my main focus. Although I can say the music is definitely catchy and worth listening too, HFX definitely did a good job in my opinion.

This game has very nice replayability too, but the story isn't really the strong suit. I personally replay for the comedy and the challenge, and I do NG+ to get gear and etc. I didn't grab the first time around. 

Overall, Matt deserves much more attention than he gets, but should never stop being a semi-solo developer. When you work with a lot of people and publishers, games like this are only dreams.

I was very dubious about this game, mainly got this because of the positive user revews (and cheap sale price). I'm not a fan of jrpgs as a rule, I've played through FF7 and 8 in the past and liked them but mainly I find both the gameplay and storytelling to be really annoying them.

I was pleasantly surprised, this game is actually super fun. The UI is relatively painless to use for the genre, fights are fun (after the dull early game) and there is even a bit of character customization. I actually enjoyed the silly story and the jokes were mostly awful but.. somehow still work. 

I did dislike the constant backtracking. Also, I played on normal and the difficulty curve was a bit annoying. Like the first third of the game there was pretty much no change of losing, and the last third felt a bit tedious since even minor fights took a while to finish. Example: pack of dogs that each spam heal to full health every turn while preventing you from casting spells, and unlike most monsters have very little vulnerabilities. Really annoying.

And then there was the boss fight, which was stupid. I had one party member using resurrect consumable on another, damn near every turn. Because the boss oneshots, through stacked defenses. I don't know how the fight is supposed to be done, I just burned through my hoarded consumables. Other than that the fight was cool but.. yeah.

Anyway, good game, worth playing.

This, in my opinion is an awesome game.
Nice atmosphere, the graphics soothe the eyes, and overall, the humor is just enjoyable.

Now, there are people on here who would dare give negative reviews about this game, calling it childish, or just terrible, and that might just shake your decision on whether to buy this game or not.

There's a solution for that: There IS a free version of this game, but it lacks a certain replayability that the premium (this one) version does. So you could go try that and decide for yourself if you want to buy this game and support the maker at the same time.

Heck, or even try the prequel you can find for free online as well! Or even the rest of the series! All the way from Epic Battle Fantasy (the first one). Though the game plays more like an exploratory RPG from the third game forth.

So why would you buy this game if you can play the free version online? Well, in my personal opinion, it just doesn't feel complete unless if you have the entire thing. Like the Battle Mountain, where you can test your abilities, skills, and equipment against some of the most difficult enemies in the game despite your level or difficulty. I also followed the creator's games ever since Epic Battle Fantasy 2 came out on Newgrounds and just want to support him and his works. And also I wanted to make my achievements public because I'm like that.

Also you'll be a filthy casual if you don't.

19017861.review:
EBF originates from a internet flash game which I originally played years ago on Newgrounds. It's a turn-based adventure RPG with elements from its counterparts in both western RPGs and JRPGs.

As far as RPGs go, it has a relatively small amount of gameplay, making it a short (but in my opinion sweet) play. Most of the fun will be had in battles, where diverse enemies and an easy-to-understand element system make it a strangely relaxing experience. The art is nice, the moves are diverse and there are references everywhere to almost anything.

Its cheap too, so thats a plus.

19003247.review:
This series has long been a staple of flash gaming, and with good reason. It's a totally solid JRPG-style game. It's easy and intuitive to play, well-written, and a great way to waste five minutes or five hours. It plays equally well in short bursts as it does long sessions.

About the only criticisms that can be made are that the game can be a bit anime-fanboy-crude, with emphasis on fan service with breasts and scantily-clad females, but the actual characterizations of the female characters are well-done, so if you can look past the lewdness, it's really not bad in that regard. The other thing is some battles can get a bit long and repetitive. Most of the time, combat can be over quickly if you're paying attention to your elemental damage, but then sometimes you'll be up against an enemy that has a ton of health, and while the enemy doesn't pose a huge threat to you, it takes a long time to kill. Still, a few battles turning into a bit of a slog isn't that big an issue, either.

Overall, it's funny and well-written and the gameplay is just an absolute charm. There are a lot of elements between the equips and elements and consumables and upgrading of items, but none of these elements are overly complex to the point where thye become annoying. It's easy to find almost any piece of information you want, and the gane doesn't penalize you too heavily for forgetting to attend to any of the ongoing tasks.

A solid installment in a solid series, heartily recommended to anyone who enjoys RPGs, anime style, humor, or casual gaming experiences. Not that the game is overly casual, but it's so easy to learn, it's a great gateway into RPGs for the casual gamer.
