18937998.review:
This game sat on my wishlist for quite some time while I hemmed and hawwed over whether or not I wanted to buy it.  Reviews were good, I've just had a not-so-great streak of games I've tried out lately.  But I figured what the heck, it looks like something I might like.

And let me tell you, it is!  This is a light-hearted 2D old-school style RPG that makes light and silly fun of many of the tropes we all know and love when it comes the the RPGs we've all played over the years.

The gameplay is very simple to learn, but you do sit and strategize a little bit when it comes to the attacks you want to use and what to equip for the best results.  It is very forgiving and easy to pick up for the casual player, you can save at any point you want and there is no rush.  You can go back an unlock previous areas you've been to for more exploration or items.

And of the items, there are a great many in this game.  You will find an upgadeable crafting system here based largely upon random drops from enemies and chests.  There are also some that you can buy.  Weapons and armor are all fairly unique in the things they do an attirbutes that they have.

This game doesn't do anything especially new or different.  It is a comfortable and well-executed little game that you can sink hours into without realizing it has gotten dark out and you ought to make dinner or at least let the dog outside.

The $12 full price is not bad, I felt it was a reasonable cost for the game.  But if you can pick it up on sale for less, I highly recommend you do if any of the above rings your bell.

Epic Battle Fantasy 4 es mejor juego de lo que a simple vista uno puede creer (su porcentaje de positivos de Steam invitan a darle una oportunidad, pero intentare evitar decepciones con esta reseña).

Si uno no es muy amigo de los jrpg de estilo clásico no tiene ni que ojear el juego, pero a quien le gusten y sepa pasar por alto su aspecto grafico simple (herencia de ser una saga de juegos flash que ha ido a más hasta llegar a Steam, en parte por el buen hacer de su creador pero tambien por el humor que el juego lleva incluido) puede resultarle entretenido un titulo tan ligero como este, no tiene una historia elaborada ni complejisimas misiones secundarias pero se deja jugar muy facilmente y suple sus carencias con momentos comicos y referencias a otros juegos. Tiene todos los elementos de un jrpg clasico y hay que poner en valor dos aspectos como son la musica y las animaciones (ambas buenas para lo que se podia esperar de entrada en un juego indie asi). El unico punto negativo es el mapa de juego, variado en localizaciones pero con unos personajes de diseño inferior y movimiento casi ridiculo.

En definitiva, si eres anti jrpg o catador exclusivo de AAA no hace falta que mires nada de este juego, pero si aceptas la humildad desde la que parte el titulo puedes pasar un buen rato jugando con mecanicas de rol japones clasicas y, lamentablemente, algo olvidadas hoy en dia.

It's a very good game for it's price if you don't take it too seriously. 

The game is very easy (specially if you compare it to some old rpgs) but the gameplay is fun with no random encounters (you can still powerlevel by leaving the area and coming back).

18184601.review:
Wow, this game is fun... and big! I'm amazed it's just a Flash game. If you're a fan of the old-school Final Fantasy games, this game is for you, especially if you like cats. :3 It's very rewarding, too, since the visuals are fantastic, the writing is fun, and the battles are tense (especially toward the end). I can't count the number of times when I was sure I was going to lose, but I somehow managed to get it together just enough to crawl to victory.

The final boss is the most tense battle I've ever fought in an RPG. The game does its best to kill you, but there's this tiny sliver of hope, and every turn feels like it will be your last. When victory finally comes, you will know it's because you tore it from the the maw of defeat with your bare hands.

At least, that's how I felt. Hopefully, I'm not just bad. :P I'm sure I could have leveled up more, but the pacing of the game made it feel like this was where I was supposed to be, and that feeling persists through the entire game. Grinding is minimal, and I only did it when I just felt like bashing some heads in for fun.

Get it. Get it, now!

17914820.review:
TL;DR: A well done JRPG styled game, with a focus on adjusting your gear and tactics for each group and boss to hit weaknesses and exploit status effects. Requires a bit of strategy for optional things, but no too deep if you just want to enjoy it.

I've actually played all the EBF's so far, and you don't need to play the others to play this one. Technically, you can play it for free on the website, minus some features, but the creator has done some amazing work on this title, so he deserves the money if you want to purchase it.

Epic Battle Fantasy has always been about adjusting your tactics to your current enemies, and 4 is no different. The game boils down classic turn based combat into a purely fun formula. Each battle, even bosses, you can run from at will, so if you find new enemies you can scan them, then flee to adjust your gear if you like, or just hammer on through if you can. Most enemies can be beaten by using gear with no downsides and the proper elements, but obviously you will get much better results, especially against bosses and larger enemies, if you adjust your gear to hit their weaknesses. Unlike most JRPGs, status effects actually matter alot in the game, and alot of them work well in conjunction. One of the best combos is the darkness status effect decreases stats over time, and increases weakness to holy...and the holy status effect reduces the other stats over time, and increases weakness to dark. This leads to combos, such as having an accessory that gives the darkness-only debuff to your weapons, and using that against dark enemies so they receive even more holy damage. The game is all about finding those neat combos and useful effects, and using them well.

The story is bare bones, but it doesn't need to be too epic (Despite the name), the summary from 3 to 4 as told in the intro is 'the heroes saved the world, so they thought they were entitled to everyones stuff, so they took it...that made people mad, insert new heroine'. The game makes light of typical JRPG tropes, without being too caustic. It also introduces new elements as you run into them, so it avoids any sort of tutorial. Sidequests are nothing more than gather materials, give to NPC.

The game has many things you can do to improve your characters besides levelling, optional skills that you can only give to one character, upgrading weapons/armor (of which there are plenty), accessories, permanent stat boosting items that can be hoarded through numerous NG+s, etc. While you can go through it on easy, the game does reserve the boss achievements only for beating them on the highest difficulty, which is an effort no matter when you do it. The optional area, Battle Mountain, is even tougher for it, as the enemies level up with you, so you have to rely on strategy (and maybe some stat boosting items) to win. Still, every group of enemies is unique in structure, and the difficulty ramps up well, a very well designed curve for the game. There is some backtracking as you gain new items, to collect old stuff, but you don't feel too put upon to do so.

Overall, I highly reccomend this game if you like a good turn based RPG that requires you to think about how to handle each encounter, without getting into a mindless slog through weak enemies.

crazy good game considering it was developed mostly by one guy. has everything that makes indie rpgs good including:

[list]

    [*]really good animation and art everywhere

    [*]grind/gear curve is perfect
    [*]very easy to influence game difficulty
[/list]

if you want a fun indie "by weebs, for weebs" rpg that doesn't require much commitment (and you've already played neptunia), support scottish developers and get this. it's a good deal at the base price and at 50% off you're robbing the poor guy.

Epic Battle Fantasy 4 is a game that you can easily get pulled into and find yourself awake till 3 in the morning playing, not realizing what time it is.
To put it bluntly, I have beaten this game twice before it was on steam, then found out it was on steam, bought it, and have 45 hours played (As of this review).
Anybody who enjoys rpg style games and has played many of them will easily be able to figure out where this game gets its ideas from, yet they all meld together so well into a fun and enjoyable experience.
EBF4 isn't a game you can't really just try to fire through quickly, because while it is rather simple in terms of an rpg, if you don't approach encounters cautiously you will be heavily punished.  At the end of the day, it is a grand experience most anyone would enjoy. 17204167.review:
[B][U]Epic Battle Fantasy 4[/U][/B], terminato finalmente.

Il gioco è alla Final Fantasy (anche se con incontri NON casuali) di derivazione Kongregate/Flash (ovvero lo hanno impacchettato per venderlo su Steam) ma merita, soprattutto se trovato a basso prezzo.

In pratica c'è una storia di base, poco emozionante (i gatti sono degli dei e bisogna affrontarne due, ma alla fine...), e si controlla un party di 4 personaggi, di cui solo 3 sul campo di battaglia. Mentre si combatte se TUTTI E TRE sono messi KO, allora entra in campo il quarto, che può, se può, resuscitare i compagni (o meglio, due degli altri) e proseguire la battaglia.

Purtroppo le battaglie sono un pò il punto debole del gioco, imho. Come detto, non sono casuali, ma i mostri sono presenti sulla mappa e si decide se affrontarli o meno. Spesso sono a difesa di bauli, per cui bisogna per forza affrontarli per ottenere il contenuto di questi ultimi. 

Inizialmente gli scontri sono abbastanza divertenti. Sono a turni, con i nostri 3 protagonisti che a turno fanno la loro mossa e poi aspettano con pazienza le mosse della CPU. Fin qui abbastanza ok. 

Il problema sono alcuni scontri che 

-si dilungano su ondate successive di nemici: ovvero, alla prima ondata ne stanno 3, li ammazzi e vi è una successiva ondata con un altro gruppo. A volte le ondate si ripetono anche per 3/4 volte o più. E questo un poco rompe gli zebedei.

-ci sono nemici particolari, come i boss o nemici più forti in un dato gruppo, con DAVVERO TROPPI punti ferita. A volte scarichi il tuo arsenale per 3/4 turni e scalfisci la loro corazza di pochissimo. Bisogna metterci pazienza. Anche se si arriva con armi ed equipaggiamenti/magie giuste. Semplicemente imho hanno calibrato a cazzo alcuni scontri. Il combattimento con l'ultimo boss mi è durato mezz'ora tra sbadigli e solite mosse. Non capisco cosa trovino di divertente gli sviluppatori, se non la loro inutilità di pensiero.

Anche la gestione di equipaggiamenti ed armi e il loro livellamento: ad un certo punto ci saranno così tante cose che non si riuscirà più a capire cosa si sta facendo per upgradare qualcosa. Lo stesso per le magie, una confusione di numeri, finestrelle e simboli runici.

Io sono andato sempre abbastanza a caso, e l'ho finito, per cui è chiaro che anche qui la superficialità è lampante (a che serveperderci ore a migliorare di un millesimo, se poi avanzi lo stesso sbadigliando?)

Vabbè, mi è durato una ventina di ore, con il 60% di achievement trovati, ma a leggere gli altri li lascerei appunti agli stessi sviluppatori, che forse non hanno un cazzo di altro da fare nella vita (finisci il gioco 3 volte? Mavvaffanculo).

Divertente, ottimo a basso prezzo, ma anche abbastanza ingegnuo su scelte di importanza elevata, trattate invece con superficialità.

Pollice su, ma con riserva.

17199748.review:
I've had nothing but a good time playing this game.

It's a JRPG style turn based combat game, with an overworld map exploration aspect to it (secrets to be found, items that open up new areas and paths usually to treasure in old areas).

There are no random encounters, and only optional enemies respawn; once you clear a 'path-blocking' encounter it remains cleared.  Turn-based combat with a focus on using skills/spells that the enemies are weak to, with a party-wide 'summon meter', lots of items and equipment to be had all with varying effects to them such as "randomly summons a wooly mammoth to fall from the sky onto an enemy each round", "randomly blesses the character", "counters attacks with xxxxx skill" things like that.

The humor in the character/NPC dialogs is light hearted if a bit geared towards a younger crowd (not kids though).

Fans of turn based RPGs should give this one a shot, it's very easy to play in short bursts when you feel that RPG itch, or you can get 30+ hours out of it like I have so far!

17087158.review:
( Review from a guy who usually play in French, sorry if this is hard to read )

Really thought that the 3rd one was the best??? That nothing could have made this game any more perfect???
Well here's the 4th game or this amazing serie.

EBF4 is a classic-styled RPG : Turn by turn combats, Équipments, Magics, Element system, ALL the Items, Aventure!!!
The game's tags already spoil it all, nothing new.

There are only 2 things you find less often in that one game tho' :
- Grinding.... ooooooh the grinding... very glad you didn't corrupt this game.
- Random battles. Yes yes! YOU decide when the action scenes starts!

The musics are amazing, so much i'm currently listening to them from the in-game gallery. Amazing idea to have more than one battle theme too, it prevents them to get repetitive too much.

The game is funny and you might need a second playthough to spot and/or get all the references mentionned in the short but frequent character's lines.

The game difficulty can be changed at will in the game's settings, so it's hard for me to give a negative point by saying that the Epic difficulty mode really can make you remember to save after every fight. Of course you could flee the battle and come back later if they are too strong for you... but really sometime you simply don't see the insta-death attack coming. 

Except for the bosses, the first 10 levels gives you short and enjoyable battles with basic tutorial windows that pop-up so new players aren't too lost. After you get to level 20-22 tho', battles can sometime get long and repetitive, especially with a high difficulty setting. Because the enemy monsters usually matches the current place you are in, it can happen that you just want to see some differant landscape in hope to see the foes also change accordingly... as you will stay in some specific 'biomes' for quite a few battles. 
The generous amount of ready-to-be-opened-gold-trimmed chests usually help you to not get too tired of these long 4-waves battles. 

The playable characters slightly lack some personality and backstory, yes, but i guess it's the perfect occasion for the 5th title to be even better that this one. Those who already played ( and loved ) the 3rd game should not see any problems with that tho'.

The price is fair, and the game deserves every single of the 9 points I can give out of 10.

17042717.review:
Look, if you've seen this game's trailer, and seen anything you liked, or even just had the time to look through the screenshots and said "Hey, this game looks like it might be good.", please just go and buy this game. If you love Final Fantasy, or Chrono Trigger, or Golden Sun, or really any rpg ever I almost guarentee that there is something here for you. The story, while geared more toward the 12-25 age range, is still an enjoyable, simple story that lays itself out nicely throughout the story. The gameplay flows very well, and it is very easy to notice that there was time put into making the characters and abilities balanced and scale throughout the game. While the game can be very easy when using the corresponding elemental rock,paper,scissors equipment to fight enemies, the battles can still be very long and challenging, making the title of "Epic Battle" very evident, especially on epic mode. The art is very well done, and the music fits the game incredibly.

It's also important to note that the other three games in the series are FREE online, so if you want a primer to what you will be getting you can go play those aswell, which I would also recommend.

All in all, this game, and this series, was a great effort by Matt Rosak and HalcyonicfalconX. Fantastic job, and can't wait for Bullet Heaven 2!

16711558.review:
[i]Key supplied by developer for review.[/i]
[h1]======================================[/h1]
[h1][b]Epic Battle Fantasy 4[/b][/h1] Read on for the full review!
[h1]======================================[/h1]

[h1]TL;DR:[/h1]

While there are a couple downsides(and only a couple,) Epic Battle Fantasy 4 features many positive aspects of classic RPG gameplay, while also lightheartedly poking fun at RPG, anime, and video game tropes. It's cheap, too, so you should definitely pick up a copy!

[h1]======================================[/h1]

[h1][b]Pros[/b][/h1]
+ RPG: It's oldschool!
+ Options: All there
+ Graphics: Cute, colorful, and with nice animations.
+ UI: Remembering the last used spells is sooo convenient!
+ Humor: Very much present.
+ Price: Low, especially for playtime.
+ References: EVERYWHERE.
+ Variety: ALSO EVERYWHERE.
+ Combat: It will keep you doing different things.

[h1][b]Cons[/b][/h1]
- Not higher resolution!
- KB Mode still requires mouse

[h1][b]Neutral[/b][/h1]
+/- You'll have to fight alot of waves of monsters.
+/- You'll also have to backtrack quite a few times. 

[h1]======================================[/h1]

Epic Battle Fantasy Four...now that's a name! Like its name, EBF4 seems to be a parody of all things RPG. It sports fairly good writing, self-aware humor, a wealth of items to find, and the equipment all has unique art assets. We're off to a good start! So what's the story like?

It's a bit like this. You're a girl from a small woodland village. Three protagonists from the previous titles in the series have ransacked your village, and its prized jewel is gone! You track them down and force them to join up with you, after realizing they didn't steal the jewel, as repayment for their pillaging. You then go on to the next village to find their jewel is also gone. Okay, you should grab some popcorn for this: The jewels are meant to be seperated, and when brought together could spell doom for humankind. This is because of Catgod. Yes. Catgod. Catgod created the world, and all its creatures. It created cats in its image, but became jealous of their relationship with humans, and decided to take the cats' arm and legs, and destroy their greatest works in the world. Now someone, maybe these cats, wants to even out the punishment! You must take your lovable band of misfits and stop them!

So, we're already in for an interesting ride. What else is there you ask? Read on!

This is the kind of game where the more I play, the more I appreciate it. There is humor in spades, which sometimes falls flat for me, but it's very self-aware, so I still appreciate it. Something also everywhere is references, and I LOVE references! Other things are also everywhere, such as: skills, summons, equipment, upgrades, monsters, quests, hidden treasure, and barriers blocking your path.

The graphics are cute, with much of the stuff in the game sporting decent and equally cute animations. There are plenty of options in the settings menu. There are overworld monsters, so when you feel like skipping battles, you can. The blockades barring your way actually keep things interesting, since your equipment will all remain useful depending on what enemies you are fighting, and everything in this game can be upgraded or scales with your level. This sets a great pace for exploration, and encourages you to find all the hidden unblocked treasures you can get your grubby hands on.

Progression has a good curve. You'll level up, find items, get new weapons, and clear areas at a steady pace. There's also a lot of content to this game, for only 12$ off sale, so you'll get your money's worth, too. The game likes to parody cliches found in anime, games, movies, you name it. The humor will keep you going even if the gameplay gets old, and if it does, a quick break is all it ever took for me to fix that.

For example, I once started a battle with a woolly mammoth to then inadvertantly drop a woolly mammoth on top of it right after my party commented about how tough the fight would be. I was close to taking a break, but instead laughed plentifully and wanted to keep going. There are plenty of other nice things that will keep the game convenient and easy to play like the ability to scan monsters and instantly see their strengths and weaknesses, the ability to leave a battle without having to play a minigame or roll dice, zone teleports, instant healing slimecats, recently used spells list, and more!

Getting around in Epic Battle Fantasy 4 is easy. The UI is simple enough, although slightly clunky. There are keyboard and mouse movement options, but keyboard mode still requires the mouse for battles, unfortunately, and there's no controller support. The game also maxes out at 720p, which is quite low for modern displays. There is also, on the negative end, ocassional lag and stuttering. There are plenty of settings to mess with so you can likely find a setting that fixes that for you.

All in all you'll want to experience this game for the story, humor, characters, references, varied battles, and sheer number of items, equipment, and potential upgrades.

16687925.review:
EBF 4 is a turn-based RPG inspired by games like Final Fantasy and Golden Sun. It's the first of the series to be on steam, as the others were browser games on websites like Kongregate and Armor Games. I  remember playing one of the EBF games, although I don't remember which one. I don't remember much, so I wasn't sure what to expect.

There are quite a few unique mechanics in EBF 4. First, the backup mechanic requires one of your four people to be in "backup", and therefore not fighing, who can be switched in without using a turn. At first I hated the mechanic, but I grew attached to it and it does make for some interesting situations. Second, when you win a battle, you get AP. This is how you obtain and upgrade skills, as not a single skill is learned through leveling. Skills in the "special" catagory can be learned by two or more different party members, but only one can actually learn it. For example, Anna and Natalie can both learn heal, but if Natalie knows it, then Anna can't. Which, I recommend you do just that, but that's just what I do.
There is also "waves" system where if a battle has three waves, you have to clear out three screens worth of enemies. This is backed by the fact that all enemies are on the map, and you can engage them at any time and flee at any time, with the only punishment for flee being that the hurt or killed enemies reset.

One of the things I love about this game is that both hardcore RPG fans and newcomers to RPG's can both enjoy the game. There are ten elements and twelve status effects, every enemy has unique resistances and weaknesses to elements, statuses, and debuffs, your party's weapons give them elemental normal attacks and armor give elements and status resists and weaknesses, a complex upgrading system with a large array of crafting materials, and the HUGE amount of skills is insane! We've got buff spells, debuff spells, elemental spells, partially elemental and partially physical, spells that damage and may caused status effects, spells that damage and may debuff enemies, spells that take away enemy buffs, take away your team's debuffs, limit breaks, spells that element changes depending on the weapon you use, spells that power up in certain conditions, spells with lots of power but debuff your character, HOLY CRAP, I'm geeking out! At the same time though, the first time you use a certain spell, or get hit by a certain attack one of your characters says some, whether it be funny (most of the time because the spell speaks for itself and doesn't require explanation), or it be important information like saying the Barrier and Heal More spells are really important (which they are probably the game's two most important spells.)

Graphically, the overworld looks much different than the battle graphics, but both serve their part well. The story isn't impressive, but it certainly gets the job done, especially considering the game is lighthearted and never takes itself too seriously. Until the final boss. That's some dark crap right there. Also, I feel the need to say this. I won't spoil anything, but I had Anna and Natalie at 31, Lance and Matt at 32, and didn't even use Lance. I changed my armor sets according to the different forms for maximum effieciency. The fight took me an hour, no joke. Speaking of the final boss, the music in the game is great. Not Shovel knight is Mega man levels of great, but pretty close in my opinion. Oh yea. The final boss theme is great. The game's lighthearted theme and humor is one of the things that kept me engaged. I loved laughing the hilarious and silly dialogue, as it just added a unique spice to the battles.

If I had to find some complaints I had, they would be few, but the one big issue I had that there is a bunch of optional content, and I wanted to do as much as possible, but it just wasn't as interesting as the main quest. There is a whole bonus area with upgraded versions of the bosses in the main story, but fighting the same enemy with better numbers and a few more tricks just... isn't engaging as fighting them for the first time. But the big kicker that killed my motivation for the bonus area was that you don't get any EXP, AP, or gold from the fight. If I got even a little, I might have gone a bit farther, but I didn't even feel up to getting past the second boss.

Overall though, it's amazing. Definetly in my Top 20 or maybe 15 favorite games I've played. Top 10 would be a bit of a stretch, but it's possible. Get it if you are a hardcore RPG fan or want to start getting into RPG's. I mean, I've played RPGs ever since I was 6, I know a good RPG when I see one. And this is a good RPG.

TL;DR Read the last few sentences.

The soundtrack is shockingly good in a nostalgic synthisizer sort of way, and though the tracks loop fairly heavily after 11 hours and counting I haven't muted it yet. 16586306.review:
Pros
+ Beautiful animations, from battle scenes to idle animations
+ Hours of gameplay
+ Changing armor/weapons changes the appearance of the character
+ Lots of additional gameplay in the post-game
+ Not just about turned-based combat; many puzzles to solve and secrets to find throughout the game

Cons
- The lack of a serious plot line might bother some

Overall score: 10/10

I can honestly only say good things about this game. If you don't believe me, you can always play the free version on Kongregate to see if you'd like it. Some of you might be wondering, "Why should I pay for a game I can play for free online?" Here are my two reasons: First, there is a lot of additional gameplay when you buy the version on Steam. It's the same version as the paid version on Kongregate, but this version comes with Steam Trading Cards, which obviously makes it superior. Second, I've been a longtime fan of the series. (My personal favorite is EBF3.) in some ways, I feel like buying this game was thanks to Kupo for all of the hours of fun I spent in all of his games. But seriously, play this game.

If you like turn based RPGs, this game will be perfect for you. The animations are beautiful, and the gameplay draws a lot from the Final Fantasy series. I also love how armor, weapons, and accessories called flairs affect the appearance of characters. It's a personal pet peeve of mine when RPGs have armor, but changing the equipped armor doesn't change what the character is wearing. You can see that a lot of effort went into this game.

The game doesn't take itself too seriously, so don't expect to be blown away by the plot. There are some immature jokes as well. Neither of these bothered me, but in fairness to the other games I reviewed, I felt obligated to list a con.

Regardless, EBF4 is a wonderful game and you should definitely buy it if you like turn-based RPGs.

I honestly have a feeling that all the negative reviews are from people who've never even bothered playing the other 3 games and know nothing about the engine that was used for this or even gave it an actual chance. It wasn't RPGMaker so you obviously fail for trying to compare Kupo to a "reddit RPG Maker /b/tard". If anything since you know reddit so well that you used categories and seen for yourself how people are on there then you must be one of said "/b/tards.". 

This game is literally an indie RPG masterpiece referencing all types of games and genres and heavily Final Fantasy referenced. I played this mostly on Kongregate and the moment it was on Steam I bought it. The OST is AMAZING. I listen to it all the time at work. Halcyonic Falcon X aka Phyrnna <3 I love you <3. You can get all the EBF4 music on her YouTube or Spotify channels. Maybe Pandora, I don't know because I don't use Pandora. You can also get the soundtrack from the Steamapps folder of this game too.

 I've been a long time fan since EBF1 and Bulletheaven. 

I can't stress how awesome this game is for what it is. There's actually A LOT to do in it and you can easily upgrade EVERYTHING. However I'm missing like 1 piece of armor I think, I can't remember but I read something about it only being available at a certain time? I forgot the full details of it. It's a well known question a lot of people have been asking about in the game because they can't 100% the armor collection. Still haven't figured it out yet. 

The thing about this game is, if you want to speed through the game, you can change the games difficulty to easy. The only difference the game makes is the damage you receive from enemies and how much health they have. Basically just a stat difference. There isn't anything too significant unless you're trying to get all the achievements in-game. The game doesn't seem to give you extra rewards after battles, just the overall challenge of the fights. I usually find it easier when I'm trying to rush through the game to just set the game on easy until I get to a boss fight because a lot of the enemy fights tend to get pretty tedious over time the I crank up the difficulty to hard or something because I can't do epicyet and I'm on my second playthrough. This game does have pretty good replayability to it. Especially the fact that you need to clear the game 3 times in order to get the achievement. However that 5m damage achievement is insane. I can't seem to pull that off with the Revenge skill when everybody but Matt is dead and Matts near dead while atk buffed. I guess I just need to farm for atk stat boost items.

I honestly give it a 9/10 for me only, because some of the non-boss battles can get really tedious and it does lose entertainment value after awhile. It's good to play this game for a few hours a day unless you decide to play on easy  the entire time until boss fights show up and crank up the difficulty.

But in general I give this game a 10/10 just because of how well made it was by 1 man and how well the music is for the game by 1 woman. It's definitely a masterpiece indie RPG. 

I can't really find anything wrong with it in general. Just a few personal afflictions I had that shouldn't affect a lot of other people as much as me.

15299934.review:
Best jiggle physics in recent games ever.

Epic Battle Fantasy 4 used to be a browser game. I used to play games from Miniclip and other websites that provide flash games, but for some reason I didn't came across this one. Boy did I missed out. In case you couldn't tell, its a turn-based RPG. It has funny jokes, fourth-wall breaking and references to other games all over the place.

Like every RPG, you go around killing enemies to get materials to upgrade equipment, doing quest and side-quest and buy stuff from shops, you know the usual stuff. And thats what makes this game great. Its a very nostalgic feeling of how a RPG should feel, but they removed one key mechanic that made this game even better.

NO. GRINDING.

Item drops from enemies for upgrades can be bought from shops so you can grind or if u have gold u can just buy it from the shops. This made me so happy to see because so many games rely on grinding to extend the gameplay which is extremely tedious. 

The characters are great, the music can be better (tho i usually play the game with the music and sfx muted cuz i can play while doing something else) and the achievements are challenging and fun.

RPGs lovers have no reason to not get this. This game is great. Cant wait for EBF5 whenever thats gonna be.

10/10

15270316.review:
I freakin' love this game.  Before I get into the controversial stuff that I like... let me just say that the battle system in this game is amazing.  You can decide which characters get which special moves, you can level skills up that you want while leaving others in the dust if you choose, you have to level up your equipment (especially in later battles) to ensure you have a nice diverse set of resist gear to survive the challenging boss fights (depending on the difficulty you set it on).

Did I mention that there are tons of hidden chests, quests for npcs (that aren't necessary for progression, just a bonus), an extra difficult bonus location for those of us that bought the game, and an amazing sound track?

I personally really got a kick out of some of the commentary between the characters.  The story is obviously very light-hearted and the gimmicky chats between the heroes is usually comical - not to mention you can click on Natalie for a chuckle now and then.  

Epic Battle Fantasy 4 for me was a breath of fresh air in a market that no longer caters to those of us who liked the traditional jrpg such as the early FF games/nes/snes rpgs of the past.  I like Skyrim and all of the clones of that new genre of rpg that are out, but I REALLY like the old style.  As someone who grew up in the 80s and 90s playing the rpgs of that time, and if you did too, you will like this game.  

Thank you so much Kupo for putting this together, I just wish EBF5 was out...

Epic Battle Fantasy 4 is a upbeat, funny and lovable game. It has great humour, interesting and well thought out characters and a fun storyline. Old school turn based RPG combat.

You play a girl from a village that had their idol statue stolen. 3 Heroes from the prior games (Not on PC all tablet) figured since they saved the world they are entitled to everything so they are on a mass pilfering spree. The villager finds them and beats them up only to find out that they did not steal the statue. The surrounding villages have also had their statues stolen. So now the 4 go out to try to find the theif.

For its simplistic look it is really a very good looking game. You can tell that this is a port from a tablet. The music is outstanding and is even available as a soundtrack. There is no voice dialog but the storyline and text dialog a great. The game makes fun of the whole RPG and Anime environment.  The characters are often making fun of each other and making jokes. Each character has a specialty and can learn most the others.

You have the main girl who does Earth damage, the second girl (the "pretty one") who uses advanced magic and anime style heals, a techno guy who uses guns and has a tank, and the last guy who does mostly direct damage "meat shield".

The game looks simplistic and will quickly ramp up in difficulty. Definitely a great turn based RPG game to have with lots of comedy!

14866674.review:
Ok, so, once upon a time there was this guy named Matt, and he decided "I'll make an RPG cause why not."
So then Epic Battle Fantasy was made, and it was cool.
A few months later, Matt talked to this girl who went by Phyrnna, and was like "You wanna help me out with this?" and she was like "k"
So then EBF 2 was made, and it was great.
So the, Matt was on his throne of loot, and he was like "this isn't working" and so he gave EBF open world mechanics, side quests, and loads of other shit.
And so, EBF 3 was made, and it was AWESOME.
2 spinoffs later, Matt decided to then just go "eh screw it" and made another, this time with more length, sidequests, enemies, equipment, skills, strategy, and of course, amazing goddamn music.
And so EBF 4 was made.
And it was concluded that the game was fucking amazing.

Ok, so, actual review:
STORYTIME
The story isn't much to ride home about, but it's enough to keep the game moving along, so it sorta works. It is still moderately engaging, and doesn't just devolve to "go here because we aren't gonna say". At least I can still remember what happened in the game.
6/10? 6/10.

The Graphics
Very colorful, slightly animu style graphics that are all in all nice to look at. Also, goddamn, some of those abilities are amazing visually (mostly the limit breaks).
8/10 m8

The Gameplay
My first runthrough was on normal mode, cause I'm a pussy. But I'm currently trying to get through the game on Hard and later on Epic, so yeah.
Basically, this game doesn't fall into the common RPG problem of being able to just spam normal attack to win except on bosses or something, and actually requires a large amount of strategy to get through it. You actually need to be able to adapt to situations, and exploit certain weaknesses to be able to defeat certain enemies (ex. That Goddamn Cosmic Monolith) 
Exploration is also awarded well in this game too. There are several points in the game where backtracking and exploration can be very useful to you, mostly after you get key items. As well, this game has two optional areas, one small and pretty easy, with the other being basically a super dungeon where the enemies scale to your level and you fight some really powerful bosses. (Again, fuck cosmic monoliths.)
Also, there are a metric ton of deifferent pieces of equipment to customize your character with, allowing you to find a way to fit almost any situation by the time you begin the New Game+ runthroughs.
Also, the two NG+ runthroughs cause the enemies to level up with you. That's pretty damn awesome.
10/10 Am playing again

Music
You ever heard of Phyrnna? No? well you should listen to her songs. The EBF 4 soundtrack, along with the soundtrakcs for EBF 3 and 2 provide some of the best songs I have heard in a video game ever. Weshdoor Concert? Amazing. Derelict Factory of Twisted Metal? Amazing. Outside the Battlements? Amazing. The Rim of Battle Mountain? Amazing. Fallen Blood? Best final boss theme ever. Every single track here is amazing, and you should listen to all of it.
10/10 would listen to Fallen Blood for the fiftieth time

srsly, get this game, also is pretty funny.

9/10 am playing several times again.

14862559.review:
Epic Battle Fantasy 4 - The first thing that popped into my head when I heard of this game was, "what kind of name is that?" Going by the title alone, you almost expect this to be the most cliche RPG ever, and it is - in a good way.

EBF4 is a bit of a parody of RPGs. You have turn based combat, level ups, and gear, just like in all your normal RPGs. You've also got characters that crack jokes at their own game, and much like the little indie game EvoLand, it likes to make reference to other games fairly often as you bash enemies over the head with oversized weapons.

At first glance, this game looks like the kind of flash game you'd play in your internet browser when you were little - the art is colorful but looks primitive and the controls aren't complex. Yet this is the kind of 'flash game' that someone poured hours and hours into, and it shows; the art style may very well be simple, but that's before considering how much you can customize your characters. Each and every helm in the game gives the characters a different hairstyle, for one - heck, I spent more time than I'd like to admit mixing and matching outfits to see what was both stylish and combat practical.

The game is very lax in terms of its rules. It could almost be said that it got rid of all the little bits that make RPGs frustrating - encounters are not random, running away is penalty free, all gear is useable once upgraded, grinding is not necessary (except maybe for Epic mode) and upgrade ingredients are plentiful. The game doesn't have you trecking an hour to get a single ingredient - everything progresses at a quick and painless pace.

Make no mistake, the game is challenging on Hard and Epic modes. One's ability to arm characters with the right attacks and gear is mandatory for taking on the game's big bosses, even if said big bosses look too comical to take seriously.

Overall, a very pleasant game, and there's no way I can't recommend it. It's not the kind of gripping story about trust and betrayal that will move you to tears, but it's a fun little title that does everything right, and should be recognized for it.

Es un juego con un argumento tremendamente simple y la trama no despierta mucho interes. Solo teneis que buscar 4 piedras,  pero eso no es todo el juego...
Es un juego que mezcla las cosas buenas de muchos RPG, y aunque al principio puede parecer muy infantil (que ojo, lo es) puedes mejorar armas encontrando objetos, tanto en el mapa, como los que te dan los enemigos. Tiene algunos puzles divertidos, muchos secretos, y aunque el mapa es relativamente pequeño, está construido de una manera que se nos hará largo y no nos dejará acabar el juego almenos que juguemos mas de 15-20 horas.
Algunas magias y armas os harán soltar alguna carcajada. 
El nivel normal al principio es muy facil, pero como luego no mejores armas y aprendas habilidades los jefes y submisiones que hay repartidas en el juego os seran imposibles.
Para acabar, los dialogos son sosos, pero adaptados a la actualidad.
Una cosa que tiene el juego es que podemos huir del combate, cambiar dificultad, grabar, quitar habilidades una vez aprendidas y otras cosas cuando queramos. Eso le resta dificultad.
Conclusión: Si nunca has jugado a un RPG o no te van mucho, este es tu juego. Y si te gustan los RPG tambien es tu juego. Recomendable al 95%. No te aburriras y seran unas horas bien invertidas.

14726671.review:
I honestly could not stress how much I recommend this game to RPG enthusiasts. I played the Epic Battle Fantasy series when it was just an evolving flash series (with a really fun bullet hell offshoot) on Kongregate. I loved each and every iteration, and I loved EBF4 to the point I sat down and went full nerd-out on it with writing things down, calculating, minmaxing, the whole nerd-works. I loved it enough I actually put money towards the microtransaction it had. When I heard it was coming to Steam, I was super hype for it, but I never was able to get around to snatching it. Now that I have it, i've revisited it and am having just as much fun - if not more! - than I was on Kongregate. 

The game itself is what I would call a tribute parody. The entire thing is self-aware of its genre, but also faithful to what it's parodying. Classic turn based combat with a rock-paper-scissors elemental / buff / debuff system, many items to equip to this end, a buttload of spells and abilities both natural to each character AND others that can be passed between each. Saving on the fly, resuming on the fly, overworld monster encounters instead of the random encounters we all are used to from classic RPGs, and those monsters tend to disappear permanently if they areb locking your main path. The scanbot allows you quick reference mid-battle to what an enemy is capable of, while also giving you a permanent bestiary entry for later reference. There are plenty of other features that really speak that an RPG enthusiast is behind the development, who has gone through the caveats and annoying nuances that many RPGs over the years have tossed at us that plenty a gamer have thrown their hands up at in rage. There is an abundance of humor, including puns, references, tropes and similar things that make fun of itself and its genre, and also referring to other games, series, memes, etc. without being overbearing and causing you to roll your eyes. 

tl;dr: This is an RPG made by, and for, RPG lovers, and I could honestly say you're missing out if you pass this up and are an avid player of RPGs.

14674142.review:
This game is an awesome bundle of fun.

It has a lot of the charming qualities that old turn-based RPGs had and it also has some decent writing to boot. There's a large equipment pool and a good variety of enemies. It's technical enough to be fun without dubming too much down. Proper preparation prior to battle can mean the difference between a 20-second battle and a 1-minute battle.

As far as difficulty goes, the game is not very hard. The endless battles, monster marathons, and boss rush modes can provide a mild challenge if you play on Epic difficulty.

Achievement-wise, there are some very simple achievements along with your standard beat-the-game achievements. There's also ones designed for hilarity (click on Natz' bewbs and touch the chicken)! You can tell the person who designed the game has a good sense of humor. The only thing I didn't like is how tedious the game felt while going through the 3rd playthrough. Since I am an achievement hunter, I felt compelled to 100% the game and trek on through playthrough #3 in order to get one of my last few achievements. One thing that I felt could have been done better is some variety when it comes to consequent playthroughs. I found myself picking up chests which served no purpose because it gave equipment I already had. If anything, those chests you've opened on older playthroughs should have something else.

I recommend this game to turn-based RPG fans. It's a good deal and provides 10-15 hours of fun on each playthrough if you casually go through the content.

14653267.review:
Bestes rundenbasiertes Indie-RPG auf Steam. 

Wer bei der Präsentation des Spiels glaubt hier ein RPG vorzufinden welches sich auf Humor konzentriert und ansonsten drittklassiger Indie-Käse ist täuscht sich! Habe es daher in der "Für-sie-empfohlen*-Liste wochenlang weggeklickt und weil Dragon Age Inquisition schei**e war mir dieses Spiel hier für den Urlaub nun doch mal gekauft.

Die Story ist nicht ultraepisch tiefgehend und sehr unkompliziert gehalten. Das Spiel schafft es allerdings trotzdem (oder vielleicht auch gerade deswegen) den Spieler immer bei der Stange zu halten dass man immer interessiert ist wie es weitergeht und den nächsten Kartenabschnitt noch erforschen will.

Die grösste Stärke des Spiels sind die Kämpfe. Seit Jahren in keinem RPG so gut ausbalancierte Kämpfe erlebt wie hier. Taktisch fordernd und Fahrlässigkeit wird schnell bestraft und trotzdem nicht frustrierend schwer. Vor allem die Bosskämpfe verdienen hier noch ein Extra-Lob.

Die Grafik ist technisch gesehen natürlich minimalistisch gehalten, dennoch hat das Spiel gewisserweise eine gute Optik und ist im Vollbildmodus noch sehr hochauflösend. Also kein Pixelsalat wie bei den meisten anderen Indie-RPGs. Zudem sind sämtliche Ausrüstungsgegenstände an den Charakteren beim Austauschen sichtbar und haben ihre eigenen Grafiken. Da können sich auch die Leute hinter RPGs mit Millionen-Budget eine Scheibe von abschneiden.

Soundtrack ist auch top. Deutsche Übersetzung ebenfalls sehr gut.

Wer mit klassischen JRPGs etwas anfangen kann sollte hier auf jeden Fall zuschlagen.

This is not your ordinary game. This game is fun. This game is indeed an epic fantasy of battles.

This is a tale of three cities: Greenleaf, Whitefall and Goldenbrick. One day, a ranger from Greenleaf - a girl named Anna - woke up to the most horrible sight: the sacred jewel was missing. For about a year, a team made up of a pirate-samurai, his red mage female partner, an ex-Nazish gun aficando and their limbless cat had wandered the land, pilfering their way through. To be honest, this sort of unscrupulous behavior was mainly because they had defeated an elder demon the previous year, and most of the world owed them a few favors - begrudgingly, perhaps - and really didn't mind. Anna's mind instantly wandered over to this group of heroes, and set out in search of them...

13848169.review:
This is the first and probably one of the very few reviews I will bother doing - Because its rare for me to fidn a game I enjoy this much. I have been following Matt (Kupo, the creator)and playing his games for a few years now. Bullet Hell, EBF3, EBF4, and a few other titles. I have to say, this fourth installment of EBF is the best. The game gets better every single time. each game has more equipment, strategies, monster and boss variety, skills, and medals. There is no way to express how much I really enjoy this game. There are tons of light-hearted jokes, and meme references. Also, there are a ton of referneces from old school games and shows - especially pokemon. "Don't thing too hard - you may hit yourself in confusion." "IM NOT THAT DUMB."........" Weak generic bat enemy used wing attack!... It wasn't very effective." Littlle things like that (and there are tons of them) make this game so much more enjoyable. Also, Matt ridicules himself and the game several times through his characters. He doesn't take himself or the game too seriously, yet he makes every aspect of it near flawless. Its one of the few games I can actually sit through more than once and do it multiple times. Also, the ability to switch from easy to spic instantly is great. Some might think its cheap, but honestly, you only get achievements on epic... no need to fight 1000s of monsters that mean nothing on epic when on the bosses matter on that difficulty.

Pros
Skill variety
Monster variety
Equipment variety
Strategy (You will get crushed... especially on Epic difficulty... if you don't think before you act)
Humor
Achiements/medals
Endless monsters and challenges
Puzzles
Multiple characters
Tons of secrets and hidden chests
Lots of quests
Graphics (pretty intense for a flash game)
Music (and they say video games don't have real music)
New game+ and several difficulties, along with ability to switch difficulty whenever.
Large map. Seemlessly merges together once you open all pathways. Lots to explore and discover.


Cons
Sometimes choppy on steam. Probably not the game's fault. Plays fine on Kongregate.
A lot of backtracking and memorizing. I personally don't mind this, but some might. There is a walkthrough for this game on kongregate if you cant find something or get stuck on a boss.

10000/10.

13842505.review:
This is a standard RPG with its selling point probably being its humor. It's pretty addicting.

The two best things about this game:

- When you get a medal, notifications appear on your steam client, the game itself (satisfying sound effect included), and if you have ASTATS open in your browser in the background, it'll appear there, too.

- What's even better, is when in game, you're fighting an enemy and it barely lived as your turn ended, then it gets struck by lightning and dies, ending the battle. Or even better, it gets crushed by a falling mammoth out of nowhere. Or two of them.

If you feel that's underwhelming, maybe this isn't for you. I recommend you play the free flash games, Epic Battle Fantasy 1~4, to see how you like it before buying it. They're on Kongregate and other flash game sites.

13829678.review:
Quite enjoyable, and very nostalgic as I had played the previous three installments which were flash games. Reminiscent of the RPGs of old, with unique new twists. Offers an arcadey experience with a plot as intricate as the Mario franchise, so you don't really need to worry about getting caught up or anything since anywhere you start is pretty much all you really need to know.
Like I said, a very arcade experience for those who want good, strategic combat out of their RPGs. Multiple difficulty levels which can be changed outside of combat. Alot of the game will be you having epic combat in a fantasy setting, but I suppose the title could have told you that much.

This game gives plenty of replay value, despite the 28 hours I clocked in at the time of this review, I haven't finished a single playthrough yet. Provided, I did alot of mucking about with sidequesting and took my sweet time, and if I went straight for the final boss things could have been done quicker, but this game features a whole host of battles that aren't part of the main map and further enhances the whole "arcade" view point.
Although, by no means is this game tedious just because you fight things alot; the main focus of the game is RPG combat, as referenced by the title, and it delivers.

People have said there's a free flash version of this game, and there is; but it doesn't include the content this has. Said content is the particuarly large "Battle Mountain" portion which has a HUGE amount of content, and this version supports up to three newgame+ runs, with enemies scaling with player level each NG+. This also runs better than the flash version, which is a given due to being a stand alone client now. The dev also did a good job with the previous three flash installments, so why not show him a little love? Alternatively, you could purchase the "full verison" on kongregate and play it there, but I feel that's less optimal. It's cheaper, but it's still going to be in flash there and ultimately not as 

Despite not having a indepth story, which isn't a bad thing mind you, the characters were still interesting to me. Graphics are pleasantly cartoony and colorful, with lots of detail and style.

Also, unlike the flash version, this has cloud saving, so temporary internet file shenanigans won't muck anything up.

Also features comedy and good times!

Ultimately, this was a good buy. I forget whether I got this on sale or not, but looking at the price I'd call it worthy of twelve dollars. On the other hand, I am a real scrooge, so I prefer to save as much money as possible when I buy things.

13791029.review:
Epic Battle Fantasy 4 is the latest game in the series of flash driven, turn based RPGs by Kupo Games. Its tiny development team, headed by Matt Roszak (Whom is credited for design, art, story and programming).

This is a game which should be praised, for the amount of effort put in. The result is a well realised and full RPG experience full of character and heart.

The game retains enough nostalgia from old school RPGs but still manages to feel fresh and new. If you’ve ever played any Final Fantasy title pre FFXI you’ll be familiar with this format. 
It gives a master class in how a turn based system should play along with all the usual elements you’d expect, being able to cast magic, summon other creatures, use items and attack and it does this as well as any JRPG does. Its appeal for me was that this is a finely tuned machine of a game. Usually with turn-based RPGs you eventually become so powerful that nothing is really a challenge, except maybe some bosses but with a combination of a difficulty slider that makes a difference and some well paced scaling of foes, Epic Battle Fantasy 4 keeps you on your toes and makes you think a little bit.

I’ve always loved turn based RPGs when done well and RPGs in general, but turn based more so than Action. The reason being it brings an element of strategy with out reliance on quick time events [which i hate]. Epic Battle Fantasy 4 makes full use of the strategic element of the genre.

It does this through its use of equipment and skills. The majority of weapons have an elemental effect which will assist you in tearing through enemies that are weak to that element and each piece of equipment has a use, without the collect and discard method used in most games. Weapons can be swapped out in combat also but this will take up a valuable turn to do so. Not only that, you won’t be receiving that free ride through an area.

The skill and specials pool is a very well implemented way of customising your characters and their skillset. Skills can only be learned by that specific character and specials can be learned by all, but only one character may have it at any one time. Once again, brings some difficult decisions forward. You can also equip the characters with items that will provide passive bonuses or abilities within battle, another little customisable option for balancing your team some buffing characters and some casting abilities at dice-rolled intervals. Gone, in this game, is any idea of an “Ultimate” weapon. For me, that’s refreshing. Each weapon can be upgraded as you collect items from combat or treasure.

The characters are well written and interact nicely. The personalities feel genuine and It seems like they are inspired by or based in some way on friends of the developer. At times they do act like close friends who have a lot of fun in each other’s company. This game is no doubt a labour of love and the small team at Kupo Games must have poured a lot of time into this game. It is increasingly rare to see triple-A games give this creative warmth, probably due to the size of the teams but Steam lets this flourish.

There are a lot of small gestures and references that experienced RPG fans will appreciate showing a good dose of humour. From the snow covered Djinn from Golden Sun in Whitefall Town to the name of some of the achievements you can gain for using new items they flow through the whole game well.

Epic Battle Fantasy’s achievement/medal system is well implemented. Some are very difficult to obtain, some pretty much laughing in the face at how ridiculous achievement systems are. When combined with the bestiary gives you that feeling of collection that a lot of games look past. It makes you want to collect them, this is important. 

A game by a turn-based RPG fan, for turn-based RPG fans, this will likely not appeal to those who only play Shooters or Wii Fit games but give it a chance and it may well draw you in. 

To wrap up, Epic Battle Fantasy 4 is an absolutely fantastic game, made even more impressive by the huge contribution by Matt Roszak. 
It is a game i’ve played over the Christmas holidays and will likely play again soon. With a Newgame+ option it is set up well for this. The art is soft and friendly, the enemies range from menacing to adorable. The mechanics are solid, the story is well written, the characters engaging and the experience is enjoyable. 


It can also be bought for next to nothing because ‘Steam’.

4 Ferrets out of 5

13773209.review:
Epic Battle Fantasy 4 is by far the best parody games I have ever played.  It pokes fun at a lot of classic console RPGs, but the real heat of the game is the way they combined what made so many other games so memorable.

The game is a simplistic true turn based RPG on the outside, but stesses a depth of strategy with a wide variety of equipment and monsters that have elemental strengths and weaknesses.  There isn't a single weapon or piece of armor in the game that is optimal for each and every battle (there are some that come close to defying this though).  You strenthen your weapons and armor through a basic crafting system that requires a hunt of scarce materials, but offers an item shop near the end of the game where you can buy the materials you might need at a hefty cash price.  There is even a achievement for poking...  Uh...  Nevermind.  The storyline and plot is pretty flimsy, but on the flip side, there isn't a need to grind to complete the game.

I strongly recommend this game to anyone who enjoys console RPGs of the 90s, even if they didn't grow up in the 90s.  There isn't any need to play the earlier iterations of the games to keep up with the jokes.

13744915.review:
There's an achievement for clicking Natalie's breasts and making them jiggle, stealing underwear, and leaving a character dead at the end of the battle. 

So, basically, you are rewarded for teasing a busty girl, running away with her intimate clothing and leaving her dead in the end. Just like real life. 10/10





But here's the real review.

Originating from a browser game, the fourth installment of Epic Battle Fantasy is on Steam, and for a very good reason. I haven't seen a lot of turn-based fighting RPGs like this one, but it really hits the spot.

It has excellent humor, and I often find myself laughing uncontrollably as I press space to advance through the chatting/cutscenes, seeing hilarious lines being announced by the characters, either in the arguing present everywhere in the game (because Natalie's boobs/Matt being a disgrace/Anna living in a tree/Lance having microcameras stored in his armor to "look" at Natalie's boobs), or in the battling of hundreds of enemies (because they are too weak/strong/disgusting/cool/tasty/scary, or because they resemble Pok*mon too much).

The characters are beautifully designed, and their personalities are constantly clashing with each other due to their differences, creating a constantly interesting atmosphere to get your mind off the battling and strategy if you're playing on Epic. There's things to like in all of them (and if you look at my profile you MIGHT find out which one is my favourite), and the soundtrack is amazing as well.

All in all, it sounds like I'm reviewing a GOTY title. And I can't say I don't love Epic Battle Fantasy the Fourth. Thank you Matt Roszak for making this game.

This game is undoubtedly one of the best flash games I played. The amount of work done to this game is phenomenal. I remember playing this on Kongregate and enjoying the hell out of it. Once I heard that the full version of the game was selling on steam, I told myself that I had to buy this. AND I played through the whole thing, including through all of the additional contents with Battle Mountain! Here's why this game is worth a look!

POSITIVES:
- HOURS of content
- Not so serious story with humorous elements of characters
- Four characters to play as (Each with unique skills)
- Many ways to customize characters (Skills, Costumes, Badges)
- Several areas to explore and tons of foes to face!
- Game presents a challenge and difficulty scales gradually
- Many RPG elements that people who are familiar OR new to them will love
- Many rewards, many prizes!
- Don't need to grind this game in order to beat it. From what I remember correctly, enemies scale to your level.
- SOUNDTRACK IS AMAZING!
- Art design of world and characters are attractive
- Can save your game anytime
- ACHIEVEMENTS!

NEGATIVES:
- No gripping or remarkable story
- For people who do not like casual RPGs, this is not your cup of tea

Overall, I enjoyed playing through this game again and experiencing the challenge of Battle Mountain! Hope this review helps make a clear picture of Epic Battle Fantasy 4!

13572720.review:

10/10

Edit: In all seriousness the humour isn't the only thing great about this game. Epic difficulty is very difficult and rewarding at the same time. There are some difficult puzzles. Late game (on epic) has some 30-60minute+ fights which are all or nothing - very tense, and very rewarding. Because of the way skills work there are some which you have to choose which character to take them on - i.e. revive which is only way besides using an item to actually revive a dead ally (which is pretty important since most attacks in the second half of the game are one shots).

This remains one of the funniest, deep, and difficult games I have played ever. And if you are complaining about getting RNGed all the time - it's the kind of strategy which is beatable in all situations if you play it perfectly. The difficulty comes in devising a game plan and equipping the right items (which all do different things like random buffs). There are also multiple ways to build your party which can all work - a lot of people have Natz as a full carry mage for example, but she is on healer duty for me :)

The only bad part of this game is the first boss where you have limited options because you have no skills yet :A

13491346.review:
So Captain, what's your opinion on this game?
...
Huh? Sorry, I was too busy playing EBF4.
Anywho, EBF4 is an RPG where you control 4 characters but you only have 3 at once. That 4th character is your backup, so you're thinking "Oh I have to take a turn to switch out and now it's going to get mulched by the enemy, great." but nope! Totally free, just take that action and you can still attack! (You can do this multiple times as well...for fun I suppose?) That's the thing with this game, it leaves out all the bull**** (Pardon my French) and leaves all the fun, such as no random encounters. But doesn't that make the game too easy? Ha ha, no. If the game is too easy, you can easily take on the upgraded bosses in the bonus stages but the normal bosses are hard enough. Considering that I always make sure to be two levels above the current boss's level, it's easy for me but I figure if I didn't do that, it'd be a challenge. A fair challenge, but a challenge nonetheless. The game is exciting and fun to play, there's always things to look out for such as hidden items, enjoyable character banter (Your mileage may vary, obviously), and so much more. It's only 5 bucks due to the sale but if it was priced on merit, I'd say it be 40-50$, 60$ would be stretching it but for a game like this, I sure won't mind coughing up the dosh for it!

13489579.review: A unique, well-thought-out RPG featuring a classic battle systesm. With 4 difficulty options that can be swapped at any time, the game has appeal to all fans of the genre, whether you're a hardcore power leveler or just rushing through the mandatory battles, the combat is simple and with many skills to level at your command, battles become more reliant on your own decisions. The dialog both in combat and in the field is witty and surprisingly well written, though some dialogues can be misplaced if missed in an earlier fight. The art in the game is fantastic - the character and enemy models are well-drawn and all have a distinct EBF artstyle. Each piece of equipment modifies the character models enabling the player to decide what their character stats will be and cool or cute they look. The story mode is fairly lengthy, taking anywhere from 15-25 hours on a normal difficulty run depending on completion and grind and features several optional challenges, with massive replayability including New Game + and Battle Island. Last but not least the music, by HalcyonicFalconX is not only great, but each piece fits amazingly with the nature of the battle or field, making the entire RPG experience phenomenal.

13478575.review: Epic Battle Fantast 4 is what most RPG's today lack. a focus on battle, skills, gear and just plain fun, exploring a vast land with as many side quests as you want without gunking up the main plot of the game. unlike other games where finishing side quests and gridning for level seams more a chore then anything EBF4 makes it all worth it by showing a clear advantage against lower level enemys as well as making the items from side quests worth the effort and back tracking some require. over all if your looking for a fun respin on clasic RPG's i highly recommend this game to anyone looking for some quick pick up and go fun

13473744.review:
Alright, to begin with let's get the tricky stuff out of the way. 

First of all, this game is cheeky and doesn't shy away from cracking jokes at everything, itself included. If you're easily offended, you might want to keep that in mind when making your decision, but ultimately it's all light-hearted and carefree. So don't make it a political thing, it's not. 

Secondly, while it's true you can play this for free on Kongregate, the Steam version (like Kong premium version) adds extra features (including new game plus), an entire new zone with bosses on illegal stimulants, supports more resolutions and you get the entire soundtrack, which is, might I say, really, really good.

Now with the disclaimers done and over with, let's get to the actual game.

It looks old school and cartoony, with turn based combat in which you slash, hack, blast and nuke your way through loads upon loads of critters, ranging from cute bushes (never thought I'd use that phrase seriously) to intimidating elementals. Elemental strength/weaknes system is in play, and there's plenty of elements and status effects to play around with. There's a lot of room for experimentation with gear and skills, and even bosses can be beaten through different approaches.

The soundtrack, as I said already, is AWESOME. No really. Just listen to it and appreciate it. It does a lot to round up the game experience. HFX has done an awesome job yet again (the only kind of job she ever does it seems).

It's not a hardcore RPG, even if it offers its challenges, but that makes it no less fun. Just a word of warning: If you decide to play this, better wear a helmet, because those shards of the fourth wall are going to be a-flyin' all over the place.

13461163.review:

Olhando para as imagens ele realmente parece ser um jogo FLASH, mas nao deixem seus olhos te enganarem. Os graficos sao extraordinarios, o design dos personagens em forma de anime, chama muita atençao do jogador. Os dialogos são sempre engraçados, eo jogo faz referencias de varios jogos.

Se voce nunca jogou nenhum jogo de RPG, definitivamente voce vai ficar confuso e levar horas de gameplay pra poder se adaptar ao jogo. Mas é claro que tem os tutorais que são extremamente uteis.

13209786.review: Опыт и вещички - вот что нужно настоящему манчкину. И здесь всё это имеется в изобилии. Каждый экипированный предмет, будь то огромный меч, пиратская шляпа, кошачьи ушки или малюсенький талисман, тут же отражается на внешнем виде персонажа. Каждого мобика бьём оружием подходящего элемента: огненного заливаем водой, мертвяков упокаиваем светом. Весь процесс сопровождается забавными комментариями героев и приятной, запоминающеся музыкой. I strongly recommend this game.

13161039.review:
I've been a fan of the Epic Battle Fantasy since I first found the original on Newgrounds five years ago. Seeing the series evolve as much as it has, finally reaching an actual release on Steam? It's a great sight.

I've never been a fan of JRPGs, but I never found EBF to be frustratingly difficult. It requires the right enough amount of micromanagement, planning, and strategy to appeal to both casual and hardcore RPG players. It's also got a very parody-minded sense of humor that's usually quite fun and rarely runs dry. One example in it's favor is South Park: The Stick of Truth, which I did like for it's humor, but the tongue-in-cheek delivery kind of killed it for me halfway. EBF doesn't do that, and I'm glad about that.

While my only real complaint would be the relative lack of backstory to cover the events of past games for those who might be new to these games, it's never so drawn out and overly complicated to not pick up on quickly. If you're looking for a new RPG to add to your library, I'd definitely make no higher recommendations.

12978628.review:
这个游戏最早我是在Flash游戏的网站上玩的，当时一口气通关了，没想到竟然打包做成了独立游戏发售了，游戏系统也有不少改变。
因为相隔太久，游戏的故事又较为平凡，我是想不起来游戏情节是什么了，总之就是主角一行人从最开始出发，一路探索下去，聚集同伴、发现道路、击败怪物、完成任务、加强装备，最后打败邪恶的敌人，非常传统的日式RPG路线。
游戏的是一种绚丽又清新的卡通画面风格，这个幻想系列有多部作品，除了这个RPG之外，还有纯战斗的游戏，还有射击游戏，都采取了同样的美术和人物风格，怪物更是萌得不行。游戏的战斗风格是采用可见敌人，切换战斗，半即时制，战斗系统简化，节奏非常快和流畅，战斗过程很华丽，辅以战斗的是丰富的技能、装备系统、合成及物品升级系统。
游戏包含了许许多多的隐藏要素，最开始就能看到整个地图，分成一块块被黑雾覆盖，如同《英雄无敌》系列，探索过的场景，地图就得以显现，这些看似不大的地块上，密布着无数隐藏通路、宝箱和谜题机关，其中是各种各样宝物和装备，要找到他们，有的需要仔细观察和尝试，有的需要解除谜题，有的需要获得特殊物品破除障碍，有的需要击败Boss，完全收集这些隐藏内容是游戏的主要玩点，不过总体需要时间并不长，4-5小时就差不多，关键的是不需要像很多游戏那样反复刷。
这游戏是强迫症患者和刮地三尺流玩家喜爱的类型。

It's a great game. I've played all of the Epic Battle Fantasy games, and this one is my favorite. Despite my dislike of uncouth humor (and there is quite a bit of uncouth humor), I find this game to be quite enjoyable. And there is also humor that I do like, so there's that. There's more content here than you can get play in any short period of time.

It's a FInal Fantasy-esque game, so if you are familiar with that, it is easy enough to figure out. Click on this, click on that, enemies get exploded/shot/sliced/arrow'd/. Level up skills with skill points. Use items. 

If I were to make one complaint, it would be that it doesn't have a Mac version. The dev said that it won't be happening for a while, so if you don't have a Windows computer, you might be out of luck.

Matt does, in fact, like swords. Even if they aren't actually swords.

Что и должно быть в играх подобного жанра...Я это к чему, поиграл в Final Fantasy 13, интересно, красиво. Но уж как-то порезали составляющую jrpg. Дико раздражает, что в современных jrpg в каждой битве мы начинаем с полными хп и т.д.  И банки хп как-то теряют смысл. А то ходишь с десятком хп, в инвентаре пару банок и ты думаешь: "А хватит ли? Пить или успею апнуться (если при апах параметры востанавливают)? А вдруг прибьют?"  Тьфу, понесло вообще) Оказуаливают игры, не только jrpg...Минимум действий и раздумий, а жаль...
Вернемся к данной игре... Ей бы движок какой-никакой и сюжет продуманее и было бы шикарно)  Хотя и придераться смысла не вижу, все-таки это не jrpg (проект-то не японский...). Понравилось и ладно)) Просто попутно понесло к схожим проектам)

P.S. Прошел игру... От слов не отказываюсь, игре бы движок какой и сюжет "помощнее" , квесты с историями - была бы идеальная игра) Запустил финалку 13 и через день эту игру) Все следующее время был в этой игре. Просто потрясающая кастомизация персонажей, мира... Как персонажи/монстры ведут себя во время боя, множество бафов, эффектов, поведение персонажей при каком-то действии и прочее-прочее-прочее. И все это приправлено "каваем" )))
Когда в первый раз запустил игру, подумалось : " Как это могло вызвать столь положительные отзывы?". А потом залип) Ни капли не жалею потраченного )  9 из 10. Чуть разыграйтесь  и игра затянет)

12395766.review:
First and foremost, this is essentially an upgraded flash game. If you dont want to pay full price (which is understandable for some people) then wait for a sale.

This game brings back the classic feel of a turn based rpg system in a warm, fun filled cartoony format. It is not a childish kind of fun, but is still best left to those who like games that are not even close to serious and are meant to just screw around with. That being said, it is possible to either breeze through the storyline or sit and grind for god knows how long on achievements. Either one works.

If anyone were to ask me if this game is worth getting, I'd respond with "Do you like cheesy, fun games that arent at all serious? If so then yes."

I have played this game when it only had the flash version and I played most of the previous versions too. It has a fun and cool story, the artwork is pretty cool and the soundtrack is amazing, I get the feels just by listening to the soundtrack while not playing the game at all.

Another thing is, you might expect it to be just another simple RPG game, but this game has a complex system with many stats and elements and you might find a great challenge while playing in the EPIC difficult, but you can also just go for the casual or normal difficult.

I would like to thank Matt Roszak, Halcyonic Falcon X and everyone else who helped to make this masterpiece.
